module Network.AWS.QLDB.Types.KinesisConfiguration

-- | The configuration settings of the Amazon Kinesis Data Streams
--   destination for an Amazon QLDB journal stream.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newKinesisConfiguration</a> smart constructor.
data KinesisConfiguration
KinesisConfiguration' :: Maybe Bool -> Text -> KinesisConfiguration

-- | Enables QLDB to publish multiple data records in a single Kinesis Data
--   Streams record, increasing the number of records sent per API call.
--   
--   <i>This option is enabled by default.</i> Record aggregation has
--   important implications for processing records and requires
--   de-aggregation in your stream consumer. To learn more, see <a>KPL Key
--   Concepts</a> and <a>Consumer De-aggregation</a> in the <i>Amazon
--   Kinesis Data Streams Developer Guide</i>.
[$sel:aggregationEnabled:KinesisConfiguration'] :: KinesisConfiguration -> Maybe Bool

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Kinesis Data Streams resource.
[$sel:streamArn:KinesisConfiguration'] :: KinesisConfiguration -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>KinesisConfiguration</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:aggregationEnabled:KinesisConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>kinesisConfiguration_aggregationEnabled</a> - Enables QLDB to
--   publish multiple data records in a single Kinesis Data Streams record,
--   increasing the number of records sent per API call.
--   
--   <i>This option is enabled by default.</i> Record aggregation has
--   important implications for processing records and requires
--   de-aggregation in your stream consumer. To learn more, see <a>KPL Key
--   Concepts</a> and <a>Consumer De-aggregation</a> in the <i>Amazon
--   Kinesis Data Streams Developer Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:streamArn:KinesisConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>kinesisConfiguration_streamArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN)
--   of the Kinesis Data Streams resource.
newKinesisConfiguration :: Text -> KinesisConfiguration

-- | Enables QLDB to publish multiple data records in a single Kinesis Data
--   Streams record, increasing the number of records sent per API call.
--   
--   <i>This option is enabled by default.</i> Record aggregation has
--   important implications for processing records and requires
--   de-aggregation in your stream consumer. To learn more, see <a>KPL Key
--   Concepts</a> and <a>Consumer De-aggregation</a> in the <i>Amazon
--   Kinesis Data Streams Developer Guide</i>.
kinesisConfiguration_aggregationEnabled :: Lens' KinesisConfiguration (Maybe Bool)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Kinesis Data Streams resource.
kinesisConfiguration_streamArn :: Lens' KinesisConfiguration Text

module Network.AWS.QLDB.Types.LedgerEncryptionDescription

-- | Information about the encryption of data at rest in an Amazon QLDB
--   ledger. This includes the current status, the key in Key Management
--   Service (KMS), and when the key became inaccessible (in the case of an
--   error).
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Encryption at rest</a> in the <i>Amazon
--   QLDB Developer Guide</i>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newLedgerEncryptionDescription</a> smart constructor.
data LedgerEncryptionDescription
LedgerEncryptionDescription' :: Maybe POSIX -> Text -> EncryptionStatus -> LedgerEncryptionDescription

-- | The date and time, in epoch time format, when the KMS key first became
--   inaccessible, in the case of an error. (Epoch time format is the
--   number of seconds that have elapsed since 12:00:00 AM January 1, 1970
--   UTC.)
--   
--   This parameter is undefined if the KMS key is accessible.
[$sel:inaccessibleKmsKeyDateTime:LedgerEncryptionDescription'] :: LedgerEncryptionDescription -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the customer managed KMS key that
--   the ledger uses for encryption at rest. If this parameter is
--   undefined, the ledger uses an Amazon Web Services owned KMS key for
--   encryption.
[$sel:kmsKeyArn:LedgerEncryptionDescription'] :: LedgerEncryptionDescription -> Text

-- | The current state of encryption at rest for the ledger. This can be
--   one of the following values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>ENABLED</tt>: Encryption is fully enabled using the specified
--   key.</li>
--   <li><tt>UPDATING</tt>: The ledger is actively processing the specified
--   key change.Key changes in QLDB are asynchronous. The ledger is fully
--   accessible without any performance impact while the key change is
--   being processed. The amount of time it takes to update a key varies
--   depending on the ledger size.</li>
--   <li><tt>KMS_KEY_INACCESSIBLE</tt>: The specified customer managed KMS
--   key is not accessible, and the ledger is impaired. Either the key was
--   disabled or deleted, or the grants on the key were revoked. When a
--   ledger is impaired, it is not accessible and does not accept any read
--   or write requests.An impaired ledger automatically returns to an
--   active state after you restore the grants on the key, or re-enable the
--   key that was disabled. However, deleting a customer managed KMS key is
--   irreversible. After a key is deleted, you can no longer access the
--   ledgers that are protected with that key, and the data becomes
--   unrecoverable permanently.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:encryptionStatus:LedgerEncryptionDescription'] :: LedgerEncryptionDescription -> EncryptionStatus

-- | Create a value of <a>LedgerEncryptionDescription</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:inaccessibleKmsKeyDateTime:LedgerEncryptionDescription'</a>,
--   <a>ledgerEncryptionDescription_inaccessibleKmsKeyDateTime</a> - The
--   date and time, in epoch time format, when the KMS key first became
--   inaccessible, in the case of an error. (Epoch time format is the
--   number of seconds that have elapsed since 12:00:00 AM January 1, 1970
--   UTC.)
--   
--   This parameter is undefined if the KMS key is accessible.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kmsKeyArn:LedgerEncryptionDescription'</a>,
--   <a>ledgerEncryptionDescription_kmsKeyArn</a> - The Amazon Resource
--   Name (ARN) of the customer managed KMS key that the ledger uses for
--   encryption at rest. If this parameter is undefined, the ledger uses an
--   Amazon Web Services owned KMS key for encryption.
--   
--   <a>$sel:encryptionStatus:LedgerEncryptionDescription'</a>,
--   <a>ledgerEncryptionDescription_encryptionStatus</a> - The current
--   state of encryption at rest for the ledger. This can be one of the
--   following values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>ENABLED</tt>: Encryption is fully enabled using the specified
--   key.</li>
--   <li><tt>UPDATING</tt>: The ledger is actively processing the specified
--   key change.Key changes in QLDB are asynchronous. The ledger is fully
--   accessible without any performance impact while the key change is
--   being processed. The amount of time it takes to update a key varies
--   depending on the ledger size.</li>
--   <li><tt>KMS_KEY_INACCESSIBLE</tt>: The specified customer managed KMS
--   key is not accessible, and the ledger is impaired. Either the key was
--   disabled or deleted, or the grants on the key were revoked. When a
--   ledger is impaired, it is not accessible and does not accept any read
--   or write requests.An impaired ledger automatically returns to an
--   active state after you restore the grants on the key, or re-enable the
--   key that was disabled. However, deleting a customer managed KMS key is
--   irreversible. After a key is deleted, you can no longer access the
--   ledgers that are protected with that key, and the data becomes
--   unrecoverable permanently.</li>
--   </ul>
newLedgerEncryptionDescription :: Text -> EncryptionStatus -> LedgerEncryptionDescription

-- | The date and time, in epoch time format, when the KMS key first became
--   inaccessible, in the case of an error. (Epoch time format is the
--   number of seconds that have elapsed since 12:00:00 AM January 1, 1970
--   UTC.)
--   
--   This parameter is undefined if the KMS key is accessible.
ledgerEncryptionDescription_inaccessibleKmsKeyDateTime :: Lens' LedgerEncryptionDescription (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the customer managed KMS key that
--   the ledger uses for encryption at rest. If this parameter is
--   undefined, the ledger uses an Amazon Web Services owned KMS key for
--   encryption.
ledgerEncryptionDescription_kmsKeyArn :: Lens' LedgerEncryptionDescription Text

-- | The current state of encryption at rest for the ledger. This can be
--   one of the following values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>ENABLED</tt>: Encryption is fully enabled using the specified
--   key.</li>
--   <li><tt>UPDATING</tt>: The ledger is actively processing the specified
--   key change.Key changes in QLDB are asynchronous. The ledger is fully
--   accessible without any performance impact while the key change is
--   being processed. The amount of time it takes to update a key varies
--   depending on the ledger size.</li>
--   <li><tt>KMS_KEY_INACCESSIBLE</tt>: The specified customer managed KMS
--   key is not accessible, and the ledger is impaired. Either the key was
--   disabled or deleted, or the grants on the key were revoked. When a
--   ledger is impaired, it is not accessible and does not accept any read
--   or write requests.An impaired ledger automatically returns to an
--   active state after you restore the grants on the key, or re-enable the
--   key that was disabled. However, deleting a customer managed KMS key is
--   irreversible. After a key is deleted, you can no longer access the
--   ledgers that are protected with that key, and the data becomes
--   unrecoverable permanently.</li>
--   </ul>
ledgerEncryptionDescription_encryptionStatus :: Lens' LedgerEncryptionDescription EncryptionStatus
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.QLDB.Types.LedgerEncryptionDescription.LedgerEncryptionDescription
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.QLDB.Types.LedgerEncryptionDescription.LedgerEncryptionDescription
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.QLDB.Types.LedgerEncryptionDescription.LedgerEncryptionDescription

module Network.AWS.QLDB.Types.LedgerSummary

-- | Information about a ledger, including its name, state, and when it was
--   created.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newLedgerSummary</a> smart constructor.
data LedgerSummary
LedgerSummary' :: Maybe LedgerState -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> LedgerSummary

-- | The current status of the ledger.
[$sel:state:LedgerSummary'] :: LedgerSummary -> Maybe LedgerState

-- | The name of the ledger.
[$sel:name:LedgerSummary'] :: LedgerSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The date and time, in epoch time format, when the ledger was created.
--   (Epoch time format is the number of seconds elapsed since 12:00:00 AM
--   January 1, 1970 UTC.)
[$sel:creationDateTime:LedgerSummary'] :: LedgerSummary -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Create a value of <a>LedgerSummary</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   current status of the ledger.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:LedgerSummary'</a>, <a>ledgerSummary_name</a> - The name
--   of the ledger.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationDateTime:LedgerSummary'</a>,
--   <a>ledgerSummary_creationDateTime</a> - The date and time, in epoch
--   time format, when the ledger was created. (Epoch time format is the
--   number of seconds elapsed since 12:00:00 AM January 1, 1970 UTC.)
newLedgerSummary :: LedgerSummary

-- | The current status of the ledger.
ledgerSummary_state :: Lens' LedgerSummary (Maybe LedgerState)

-- | The name of the ledger.
ledgerSummary_name :: Lens' LedgerSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The date and time, in epoch time format, when the ledger was created.
--   (Epoch time format is the number of seconds elapsed since 12:00:00 AM
--   January 1, 1970 UTC.)
ledgerSummary_creationDateTime :: Lens' LedgerSummary (Maybe UTCTime)

instance Network.AWS.Data.Text.FromText Network.AWS.QLDB.Types.S3ObjectEncryptionType.S3ObjectEncryptionType
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.QLDB.Types.S3ObjectEncryptionType.S3ObjectEncryptionType
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.QLDB.Types.S3ObjectEncryptionType.S3ObjectEncryptionType
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.QLDB.Types.S3ObjectEncryptionType.S3ObjectEncryptionType
instance GHC.Classes.Ord Network.AWS.QLDB.Types.S3ObjectEncryptionType.S3ObjectEncryptionType
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.QLDB.Types.S3ObjectEncryptionType.S3ObjectEncryptionType
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.QLDB.Types.S3ObjectEncryptionType.S3ObjectEncryptionType
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.QLDB.Types.S3ObjectEncryptionType.S3ObjectEncryptionType


module Network.AWS.QLDB.Types.S3EncryptionConfiguration

-- | The encryption settings that are used by a journal export job to write
--   data in an Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) bucket.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newS3EncryptionConfiguration</a> smart constructor.
data S3EncryptionConfiguration
S3EncryptionConfiguration' :: Maybe Text -> S3ObjectEncryptionType -> S3EncryptionConfiguration

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a symmetric customer master key
--   (CMK) in Key Management Service (KMS). Amazon S3 does not support
--   asymmetric CMKs.
--   
--   You must provide a <tt>KmsKeyArn</tt> if you specify <tt>SSE_KMS</tt>
--   as the <tt>ObjectEncryptionType</tt>.
--   
--   <tt>KmsKeyArn</tt> is not required if you specify <tt>SSE_S3</tt> as
--   the <tt>ObjectEncryptionType</tt>.
[$sel:kmsKeyArn:S3EncryptionConfiguration'] :: S3EncryptionConfiguration -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon S3 object encryption type.
--   
--   To learn more about server-side encryption options in Amazon S3, see
--   <a>Protecting Data Using Server-Side Encryption</a> in the <i>Amazon
--   S3 Developer Guide</i>.
[$sel:objectEncryptionType:S3EncryptionConfiguration'] :: S3EncryptionConfiguration -> S3ObjectEncryptionType

-- | Create a value of <a>S3EncryptionConfiguration</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:kmsKeyArn:S3EncryptionConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>s3EncryptionConfiguration_kmsKeyArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) of a symmetric customer master key (CMK) in Key Management
--   Service (KMS). Amazon S3 does not support asymmetric CMKs.
--   
--   You must provide a <tt>KmsKeyArn</tt> if you specify <tt>SSE_KMS</tt>
--   as the <tt>ObjectEncryptionType</tt>.
--   
--   <tt>KmsKeyArn</tt> is not required if you specify <tt>SSE_S3</tt> as
--   the <tt>ObjectEncryptionType</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:objectEncryptionType:S3EncryptionConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>s3EncryptionConfiguration_objectEncryptionType</a> - The Amazon S3
--   object encryption type.
--   
--   To learn more about server-side encryption options in Amazon S3, see
--   <a>Protecting Data Using Server-Side Encryption</a> in the <i>Amazon
--   S3 Developer Guide</i>.
newS3EncryptionConfiguration :: S3ObjectEncryptionType -> S3EncryptionConfiguration

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a symmetric customer master key
--   (CMK) in Key Management Service (KMS). Amazon S3 does not support
--   asymmetric CMKs.
--   
--   You must provide a <tt>KmsKeyArn</tt> if you specify <tt>SSE_KMS</tt>
--   as the <tt>ObjectEncryptionType</tt>.
--   
--   <tt>KmsKeyArn</tt> is not required if you specify <tt>SSE_S3</tt> as
--   the <tt>ObjectEncryptionType</tt>.
s3EncryptionConfiguration_kmsKeyArn :: Lens' S3EncryptionConfiguration (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon S3 object encryption type.
--   
--   To learn more about server-side encryption options in Amazon S3, see
--   <a>Protecting Data Using Server-Side Encryption</a> in the <i>Amazon
--   S3 Developer Guide</i>.
s3EncryptionConfiguration_objectEncryptionType :: Lens' S3EncryptionConfiguration S3ObjectEncryptionType
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.QLDB.Types.S3EncryptionConfiguration.S3EncryptionConfiguration
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.QLDB.Types.S3EncryptionConfiguration.S3EncryptionConfiguration
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.QLDB.Types.S3EncryptionConfiguration.S3EncryptionConfiguration
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.QLDB.Types.S3EncryptionConfiguration.S3EncryptionConfiguration
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.QLDB.Types.S3EncryptionConfiguration.S3EncryptionConfiguration
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.QLDB.Types.S3EncryptionConfiguration.S3EncryptionConfiguration
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.QLDB.Types.S3EncryptionConfiguration.S3EncryptionConfiguration
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.QLDB.Types.S3EncryptionConfiguration.S3EncryptionConfiguration


module Network.AWS.QLDB.Types.S3ExportConfiguration

-- | The Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) bucket location in which
--   a journal export job writes the journal contents.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newS3ExportConfiguration</a> smart constructor.
data S3ExportConfiguration
S3ExportConfiguration' :: Text -> Text -> S3EncryptionConfiguration -> S3ExportConfiguration

-- | The Amazon S3 bucket name in which a journal export job writes the
--   journal contents.
--   
--   The bucket name must comply with the Amazon S3 bucket naming
--   conventions. For more information, see <a>Bucket Restrictions and
--   Limitations</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 Developer Guide</i>.
[$sel:bucket:S3ExportConfiguration'] :: S3ExportConfiguration -> Text

-- | The prefix for the Amazon S3 bucket in which a journal export job
--   writes the journal contents.
--   
--   The prefix must comply with Amazon S3 key naming rules and
--   restrictions. For more information, see <a>Object Key and Metadata</a>
--   in the <i>Amazon S3 Developer Guide</i>.
--   
--   The following are examples of valid <tt>Prefix</tt> values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>JournalExports-ForMyLedger/Testing/</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>JournalExports</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>My:Tests/</pre></li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:prefix:S3ExportConfiguration'] :: S3ExportConfiguration -> Text

-- | The encryption settings that are used by a journal export job to write
--   data in an Amazon S3 bucket.
[$sel:encryptionConfiguration:S3ExportConfiguration'] :: S3ExportConfiguration -> S3EncryptionConfiguration

-- | Create a value of <a>S3ExportConfiguration</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:bucket:S3ExportConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>s3ExportConfiguration_bucket</a> - The Amazon S3 bucket name in
--   which a journal export job writes the journal contents.
--   
--   The bucket name must comply with the Amazon S3 bucket naming
--   conventions. For more information, see <a>Bucket Restrictions and
--   Limitations</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 Developer Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:prefix:S3ExportConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>s3ExportConfiguration_prefix</a> - The prefix for the Amazon S3
--   bucket in which a journal export job writes the journal contents.
--   
--   The prefix must comply with Amazon S3 key naming rules and
--   restrictions. For more information, see <a>Object Key and Metadata</a>
--   in the <i>Amazon S3 Developer Guide</i>.
--   
--   The following are examples of valid <tt>Prefix</tt> values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>JournalExports-ForMyLedger/Testing/</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>JournalExports</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>My:Tests/</pre></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:encryptionConfiguration:S3ExportConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>s3ExportConfiguration_encryptionConfiguration</a> - The encryption
--   settings that are used by a journal export job to write data in an
--   Amazon S3 bucket.
newS3ExportConfiguration :: Text -> Text -> S3EncryptionConfiguration -> S3ExportConfiguration

-- | The Amazon S3 bucket name in which a journal export job writes the
--   journal contents.
--   
--   The bucket name must comply with the Amazon S3 bucket naming
--   conventions. For more information, see <a>Bucket Restrictions and
--   Limitations</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 Developer Guide</i>.
s3ExportConfiguration_bucket :: Lens' S3ExportConfiguration Text

-- | The prefix for the Amazon S3 bucket in which a journal export job
--   writes the journal contents.
--   
--   The prefix must comply with Amazon S3 key naming rules and
--   restrictions. For more information, see <a>Object Key and Metadata</a>
--   in the <i>Amazon S3 Developer Guide</i>.
--   
--   The following are examples of valid <tt>Prefix</tt> values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>JournalExports-ForMyLedger/Testing/</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>JournalExports</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>My:Tests/</pre></li>
--   </ul>
s3ExportConfiguration_prefix :: Lens' S3ExportConfiguration Text

-- | The encryption settings that are used by a journal export job to write
--   data in an Amazon S3 bucket.
s3ExportConfiguration_encryptionConfiguration :: Lens' S3ExportConfiguration S3EncryptionConfiguration
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.QLDB.Types.S3ExportConfiguration.S3ExportConfiguration
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.QLDB.Types.S3ExportConfiguration.S3ExportConfiguration
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.QLDB.Types.S3ExportConfiguration.S3ExportConfiguration
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.QLDB.Types.S3ExportConfiguration.S3ExportConfiguration
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.QLDB.Types.S3ExportConfiguration.S3ExportConfiguration
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.QLDB.Types.S3ExportConfiguration.S3ExportConfiguration
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.QLDB.Types.S3ExportConfiguration.S3ExportConfiguration
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.QLDB.Types.S3ExportConfiguration.S3ExportConfiguration


module Network.AWS.QLDB.Types.JournalS3ExportDescription

-- | Information about a journal export job, including the ledger name,
--   export ID, creation time, current status, and the parameters of the
--   original export creation request.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newJournalS3ExportDescription</a> smart constructor.
data JournalS3ExportDescription
JournalS3ExportDescription' :: Text -> Text -> POSIX -> ExportStatus -> POSIX -> POSIX -> S3ExportConfiguration -> Text -> JournalS3ExportDescription

-- | The name of the ledger.
[$sel:ledgerName:JournalS3ExportDescription'] :: JournalS3ExportDescription -> Text

-- | The UUID (represented in Base62-encoded text) of the journal export
--   job.
[$sel:exportId:JournalS3ExportDescription'] :: JournalS3ExportDescription -> Text

-- | The date and time, in epoch time format, when the export job was
--   created. (Epoch time format is the number of seconds elapsed since
--   12:00:00 AM January 1, 1970 UTC.)
[$sel:exportCreationTime:JournalS3ExportDescription'] :: JournalS3ExportDescription -> POSIX

-- | The current state of the journal export job.
[$sel:status:JournalS3ExportDescription'] :: JournalS3ExportDescription -> ExportStatus

-- | The inclusive start date and time for the range of journal contents
--   that are specified in the original export request.
[$sel:inclusiveStartTime:JournalS3ExportDescription'] :: JournalS3ExportDescription -> POSIX

-- | The exclusive end date and time for the range of journal contents that
--   are specified in the original export request.
[$sel:exclusiveEndTime:JournalS3ExportDescription'] :: JournalS3ExportDescription -> POSIX
[$sel:s3ExportConfiguration:JournalS3ExportDescription'] :: JournalS3ExportDescription -> S3ExportConfiguration

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that grants QLDB
--   permissions for a journal export job to do the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Write objects into your Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3)
--   bucket.</li>
--   <li>(Optional) Use your customer master key (CMK) in Key Management
--   Service (KMS) for server-side encryption of your exported data.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:roleArn:JournalS3ExportDescription'] :: JournalS3ExportDescription -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>JournalS3ExportDescription</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:ledgerName:JournalS3ExportDescription'</a>,
--   <a>journalS3ExportDescription_ledgerName</a> - The name of the ledger.
--   
--   <a>$sel:exportId:JournalS3ExportDescription'</a>,
--   <a>journalS3ExportDescription_exportId</a> - The UUID (represented in
--   Base62-encoded text) of the journal export job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:exportCreationTime:JournalS3ExportDescription'</a>,
--   <a>journalS3ExportDescription_exportCreationTime</a> - The date and
--   time, in epoch time format, when the export job was created. (Epoch
--   time format is the number of seconds elapsed since 12:00:00 AM January
--   1, 1970 UTC.)
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:JournalS3ExportDescription'</a>,
--   <a>journalS3ExportDescription_status</a> - The current state of the
--   journal export job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:inclusiveStartTime:JournalS3ExportDescription'</a>,
--   <a>journalS3ExportDescription_inclusiveStartTime</a> - The inclusive
--   start date and time for the range of journal contents that are
--   specified in the original export request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:exclusiveEndTime:JournalS3ExportDescription'</a>,
--   <a>journalS3ExportDescription_exclusiveEndTime</a> - The exclusive end
--   date and time for the range of journal contents that are specified in
--   the original export request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:s3ExportConfiguration:JournalS3ExportDescription'</a>,
--   <a>journalS3ExportDescription_s3ExportConfiguration</a> - Undocumented
--   member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleArn:JournalS3ExportDescription'</a>,
--   <a>journalS3ExportDescription_roleArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) of the IAM role that grants QLDB permissions for a journal
--   export job to do the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Write objects into your Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3)
--   bucket.</li>
--   <li>(Optional) Use your customer master key (CMK) in Key Management
--   Service (KMS) for server-side encryption of your exported data.</li>
--   </ul>
newJournalS3ExportDescription :: Text -> Text -> UTCTime -> ExportStatus -> UTCTime -> UTCTime -> S3ExportConfiguration -> Text -> JournalS3ExportDescription

-- | The name of the ledger.
journalS3ExportDescription_ledgerName :: Lens' JournalS3ExportDescription Text

-- | The UUID (represented in Base62-encoded text) of the journal export
--   job.
journalS3ExportDescription_exportId :: Lens' JournalS3ExportDescription Text

-- | The date and time, in epoch time format, when the export job was
--   created. (Epoch time format is the number of seconds elapsed since
--   12:00:00 AM January 1, 1970 UTC.)
journalS3ExportDescription_exportCreationTime :: Lens' JournalS3ExportDescription UTCTime

-- | The current state of the journal export job.
journalS3ExportDescription_status :: Lens' JournalS3ExportDescription ExportStatus

-- | The inclusive start date and time for the range of journal contents
--   that are specified in the original export request.
journalS3ExportDescription_inclusiveStartTime :: Lens' JournalS3ExportDescription UTCTime

-- | The exclusive end date and time for the range of journal contents that
--   are specified in the original export request.
journalS3ExportDescription_exclusiveEndTime :: Lens' JournalS3ExportDescription UTCTime

-- | Undocumented member.
journalS3ExportDescription_s3ExportConfiguration :: Lens' JournalS3ExportDescription S3ExportConfiguration

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that grants QLDB
--   permissions for a journal export job to do the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Write objects into your Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3)
--   bucket.</li>
--   <li>(Optional) Use your customer master key (CMK) in Key Management
--   Service (KMS) for server-side encryption of your exported data.</li>
--   </ul>
journalS3ExportDescription_roleArn :: Lens' JournalS3ExportDescription Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.QLDB.Types.JournalS3ExportDescription.JournalS3ExportDescription
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.QLDB.Types.JournalS3ExportDescription.JournalS3ExportDescription
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.QLDB.Types.JournalS3ExportDescription.JournalS3ExportDescription
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.QLDB.Types.JournalS3ExportDescription.JournalS3ExportDescription
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.QLDB.Types.JournalS3ExportDescription.JournalS3ExportDescription
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.QLDB.Types.JournalS3ExportDescription.JournalS3ExportDescription
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.QLDB.Types.JournalS3ExportDescription.JournalS3ExportDescription


module Network.AWS.QLDB.Types.StreamStatus
newtype StreamStatus
StreamStatus' :: Text -> StreamStatus
[fromStreamStatus] :: StreamStatus -> Text
pattern StreamStatus_ACTIVE :: StreamStatus
pattern StreamStatus_CANCELED :: StreamStatus
pattern StreamStatus_COMPLETED :: StreamStatus
pattern StreamStatus_FAILED :: StreamStatus
pattern StreamStatus_IMPAIRED :: StreamStatus
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.ToXML Network.AWS.QLDB.Types.StreamStatus.StreamStatus
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.QLDB.Types.StreamStatus.StreamStatus
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSONKey Network.AWS.QLDB.Types.StreamStatus.StreamStatus
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.QLDB.Types.StreamStatus.StreamStatus
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSONKey Network.AWS.QLDB.Types.StreamStatus.StreamStatus
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.QLDB.Types.StreamStatus.StreamStatus
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.QLDB.Types.StreamStatus.StreamStatus
instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeader Network.AWS.QLDB.Types.StreamStatus.StreamStatus
instance Network.AWS.Data.Log.ToLog Network.AWS.QLDB.Types.StreamStatus.StreamStatus
instance Network.AWS.Data.ByteString.ToByteString Network.AWS.QLDB.Types.StreamStatus.StreamStatus
instance Network.AWS.Data.Text.ToText Network.AWS.QLDB.Types.StreamStatus.StreamStatus
instance Network.AWS.Data.Text.FromText Network.AWS.QLDB.Types.StreamStatus.StreamStatus
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.QLDB.Types.StreamStatus.StreamStatus
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.QLDB.Types.StreamStatus.StreamStatus
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.QLDB.Types.StreamStatus.StreamStatus
instance GHC.Classes.Ord Network.AWS.QLDB.Types.StreamStatus.StreamStatus
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.QLDB.Types.StreamStatus.StreamStatus
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.QLDB.Types.StreamStatus.StreamStatus
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.QLDB.Types.StreamStatus.StreamStatus


module Network.AWS.QLDB.Types.JournalKinesisStreamDescription

-- | Information about an Amazon QLDB journal stream, including the Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN), stream name, creation time, current status, and
--   the parameters of the original stream creation request.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newJournalKinesisStreamDescription</a> smart
--   constructor.
data JournalKinesisStreamDescription
JournalKinesisStreamDescription' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe ErrorCause -> Maybe POSIX -> Text -> Text -> Text -> StreamStatus -> KinesisConfiguration -> Text -> JournalKinesisStreamDescription

-- | The date and time, in epoch time format, when the QLDB journal stream
--   was created. (Epoch time format is the number of seconds elapsed since
--   12:00:00 AM January 1, 1970 UTC.)
[$sel:creationTime:JournalKinesisStreamDescription'] :: JournalKinesisStreamDescription -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the QLDB journal stream.
[$sel:arn:JournalKinesisStreamDescription'] :: JournalKinesisStreamDescription -> Maybe Text

-- | The inclusive start date and time from which to start streaming
--   journal data.
[$sel:inclusiveStartTime:JournalKinesisStreamDescription'] :: JournalKinesisStreamDescription -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The error message that describes the reason that a stream has a status
--   of <tt>IMPAIRED</tt> or <tt>FAILED</tt>. This is not applicable to
--   streams that have other status values.
[$sel:errorCause:JournalKinesisStreamDescription'] :: JournalKinesisStreamDescription -> Maybe ErrorCause

-- | The exclusive date and time that specifies when the stream ends. If
--   this parameter is undefined, the stream runs indefinitely until you
--   cancel it.
[$sel:exclusiveEndTime:JournalKinesisStreamDescription'] :: JournalKinesisStreamDescription -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The name of the ledger.
[$sel:ledgerName:JournalKinesisStreamDescription'] :: JournalKinesisStreamDescription -> Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that grants QLDB
--   permissions for a journal stream to write data records to a Kinesis
--   Data Streams resource.
[$sel:roleArn:JournalKinesisStreamDescription'] :: JournalKinesisStreamDescription -> Text

-- | The UUID (represented in Base62-encoded text) of the QLDB journal
--   stream.
[$sel:streamId:JournalKinesisStreamDescription'] :: JournalKinesisStreamDescription -> Text

-- | The current state of the QLDB journal stream.
[$sel:status:JournalKinesisStreamDescription'] :: JournalKinesisStreamDescription -> StreamStatus

-- | The configuration settings of the Amazon Kinesis Data Streams
--   destination for a QLDB journal stream.
[$sel:kinesisConfiguration:JournalKinesisStreamDescription'] :: JournalKinesisStreamDescription -> KinesisConfiguration

-- | The user-defined name of the QLDB journal stream.
[$sel:streamName:JournalKinesisStreamDescription'] :: JournalKinesisStreamDescription -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>JournalKinesisStreamDescription</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationTime:JournalKinesisStreamDescription'</a>,
--   <a>journalKinesisStreamDescription_creationTime</a> - The date and
--   time, in epoch time format, when the QLDB journal stream was created.
--   (Epoch time format is the number of seconds elapsed since 12:00:00 AM
--   January 1, 1970 UTC.)
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:JournalKinesisStreamDescription'</a>,
--   <a>journalKinesisStreamDescription_arn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) of the QLDB journal stream.
--   
--   <a>$sel:inclusiveStartTime:JournalKinesisStreamDescription'</a>,
--   <a>journalKinesisStreamDescription_inclusiveStartTime</a> - The
--   inclusive start date and time from which to start streaming journal
--   data.
--   
--   <a>$sel:errorCause:JournalKinesisStreamDescription'</a>,
--   <a>journalKinesisStreamDescription_errorCause</a> - The error message
--   that describes the reason that a stream has a status of
--   <tt>IMPAIRED</tt> or <tt>FAILED</tt>. This is not applicable to
--   streams that have other status values.
--   
--   <a>$sel:exclusiveEndTime:JournalKinesisStreamDescription'</a>,
--   <a>journalKinesisStreamDescription_exclusiveEndTime</a> - The
--   exclusive date and time that specifies when the stream ends. If this
--   parameter is undefined, the stream runs indefinitely until you cancel
--   it.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ledgerName:JournalKinesisStreamDescription'</a>,
--   <a>journalKinesisStreamDescription_ledgerName</a> - The name of the
--   ledger.
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleArn:JournalKinesisStreamDescription'</a>,
--   <a>journalKinesisStreamDescription_roleArn</a> - The Amazon Resource
--   Name (ARN) of the IAM role that grants QLDB permissions for a journal
--   stream to write data records to a Kinesis Data Streams resource.
--   
--   <a>$sel:streamId:JournalKinesisStreamDescription'</a>,
--   <a>journalKinesisStreamDescription_streamId</a> - The UUID
--   (represented in Base62-encoded text) of the QLDB journal stream.
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:JournalKinesisStreamDescription'</a>,
--   <a>journalKinesisStreamDescription_status</a> - The current state of
--   the QLDB journal stream.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kinesisConfiguration:JournalKinesisStreamDescription'</a>,
--   <a>journalKinesisStreamDescription_kinesisConfiguration</a> - The
--   configuration settings of the Amazon Kinesis Data Streams destination
--   for a QLDB journal stream.
--   
--   <a>$sel:streamName:JournalKinesisStreamDescription'</a>,
--   <a>journalKinesisStreamDescription_streamName</a> - The user-defined
--   name of the QLDB journal stream.
newJournalKinesisStreamDescription :: Text -> Text -> Text -> StreamStatus -> KinesisConfiguration -> Text -> JournalKinesisStreamDescription

-- | The date and time, in epoch time format, when the QLDB journal stream
--   was created. (Epoch time format is the number of seconds elapsed since
--   12:00:00 AM January 1, 1970 UTC.)
journalKinesisStreamDescription_creationTime :: Lens' JournalKinesisStreamDescription (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the QLDB journal stream.
journalKinesisStreamDescription_arn :: Lens' JournalKinesisStreamDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | The inclusive start date and time from which to start streaming
--   journal data.
journalKinesisStreamDescription_inclusiveStartTime :: Lens' JournalKinesisStreamDescription (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The error message that describes the reason that a stream has a status
--   of <tt>IMPAIRED</tt> or <tt>FAILED</tt>. This is not applicable to
--   streams that have other status values.
journalKinesisStreamDescription_errorCause :: Lens' JournalKinesisStreamDescription (Maybe ErrorCause)

-- | The exclusive date and time that specifies when the stream ends. If
--   this parameter is undefined, the stream runs indefinitely until you
--   cancel it.
journalKinesisStreamDescription_exclusiveEndTime :: Lens' JournalKinesisStreamDescription (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The name of the ledger.
journalKinesisStreamDescription_ledgerName :: Lens' JournalKinesisStreamDescription Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that grants QLDB
--   permissions for a journal stream to write data records to a Kinesis
--   Data Streams resource.
journalKinesisStreamDescription_roleArn :: Lens' JournalKinesisStreamDescription Text

-- | The UUID (represented in Base62-encoded text) of the QLDB journal
--   stream.
journalKinesisStreamDescription_streamId :: Lens' JournalKinesisStreamDescription Text

-- | The current state of the QLDB journal stream.
journalKinesisStreamDescription_status :: Lens' JournalKinesisStreamDescription StreamStatus

-- | The configuration settings of the Amazon Kinesis Data Streams
--   destination for a QLDB journal stream.
journalKinesisStreamDescription_kinesisConfiguration :: Lens' JournalKinesisStreamDescription KinesisConfiguration

-- | The user-defined name of the QLDB journal stream.
journalKinesisStreamDescription_streamName :: Lens' JournalKinesisStreamDescription Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.QLDB.Types.JournalKinesisStreamDescription.JournalKinesisStreamDescription
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.QLDB.Types.JournalKinesisStreamDescription.JournalKinesisStreamDescription
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.QLDB.Types.JournalKinesisStreamDescription.JournalKinesisStreamDescription
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.QLDB.Types.JournalKinesisStreamDescription.JournalKinesisStreamDescription
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.QLDB.Types.JournalKinesisStreamDescription.JournalKinesisStreamDescription
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.QLDB.Types.JournalKinesisStreamDescription.JournalKinesisStreamDescription
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.QLDB.Types.JournalKinesisStreamDescription.JournalKinesisStreamDescription


module Network.AWS.QLDB.Types.ValueHolder

-- | A structure that can contain a value in multiple encoding formats.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newValueHolder</a> smart constructor.
data ValueHolder
ValueHolder' :: Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> ValueHolder

-- | An Amazon Ion plaintext value contained in a <tt>ValueHolder</tt>
--   structure.
[$sel:ionText:ValueHolder'] :: ValueHolder -> Maybe (Sensitive Text)

-- | Create a value of <a>ValueHolder</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:ionText:ValueHolder'</a>, <a>valueHolder_ionText</a> - An
--   Amazon Ion plaintext value contained in a <tt>ValueHolder</tt>
--   structure.
newValueHolder :: ValueHolder

-- | An Amazon Ion plaintext value contained in a <tt>ValueHolder</tt>
--   structure.
valueHolder_ionText :: Lens' ValueHolder (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.QLDB.Types.ValueHolder.ValueHolder
