-- | Returns a revision data object for a specified document ID and block
--   address. Also returns a proof of the specified revision for
--   verification if <tt>DigestTipAddress</tt> is provided.
module Network.AWS.QLDB.GetRevision

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newGetRevision</a> smart constructor.
data GetRevision
GetRevision' :: Maybe (Sensitive ValueHolder) -> Text -> Sensitive ValueHolder -> Text -> GetRevision

-- | The latest block location covered by the digest for which to request a
--   proof. An address is an Amazon Ion structure that has two fields:
--   <tt>strandId</tt> and <tt>sequenceNo</tt>.
--   
--   For example:
--   <tt>{strandId:"BlFTjlSXze9BIh1KOszcE3",sequenceNo:49}</tt>.
[$sel:digestTipAddress:GetRevision'] :: GetRevision -> Maybe (Sensitive ValueHolder)

-- | The name of the ledger.
[$sel:name:GetRevision'] :: GetRevision -> Text

-- | The block location of the document revision to be verified. An address
--   is an Amazon Ion structure that has two fields: <tt>strandId</tt> and
--   <tt>sequenceNo</tt>.
--   
--   For example:
--   <tt>{strandId:"BlFTjlSXze9BIh1KOszcE3",sequenceNo:14}</tt>.
[$sel:blockAddress:GetRevision'] :: GetRevision -> Sensitive ValueHolder

-- | The UUID (represented in Base62-encoded text) of the document to be
--   verified.
[$sel:documentId:GetRevision'] :: GetRevision -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>GetRevision</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:digestTipAddress:GetRevision'</a>,
--   <a>getRevision_digestTipAddress</a> - The latest block location
--   covered by the digest for which to request a proof. An address is an
--   Amazon Ion structure that has two fields: <tt>strandId</tt> and
--   <tt>sequenceNo</tt>.
--   
--   For example:
--   <tt>{strandId:"BlFTjlSXze9BIh1KOszcE3",sequenceNo:49}</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:GetRevision'</a>, <a>getRevision_name</a> - The name of
--   the ledger.
--   
--   <a>$sel:blockAddress:GetRevision'</a>, <a>getRevision_blockAddress</a>
--   - The block location of the document revision to be verified. An
--   address is an Amazon Ion structure that has two fields:
--   <tt>strandId</tt> and <tt>sequenceNo</tt>.
--   
--   For example:
--   <tt>{strandId:"BlFTjlSXze9BIh1KOszcE3",sequenceNo:14}</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:documentId:GetRevision'</a>, <a>getRevision_documentId</a> -
--   The UUID (represented in Base62-encoded text) of the document to be
--   verified.
newGetRevision :: Text -> ValueHolder -> Text -> GetRevision

-- | The latest block location covered by the digest for which to request a
--   proof. An address is an Amazon Ion structure that has two fields:
--   <tt>strandId</tt> and <tt>sequenceNo</tt>.
--   
--   For example:
--   <tt>{strandId:"BlFTjlSXze9BIh1KOszcE3",sequenceNo:49}</tt>.
getRevision_digestTipAddress :: Lens' GetRevision (Maybe ValueHolder)

-- | The name of the ledger.
getRevision_name :: Lens' GetRevision Text

-- | The block location of the document revision to be verified. An address
--   is an Amazon Ion structure that has two fields: <tt>strandId</tt> and
--   <tt>sequenceNo</tt>.
--   
--   For example:
--   <tt>{strandId:"BlFTjlSXze9BIh1KOszcE3",sequenceNo:14}</tt>.
getRevision_blockAddress :: Lens' GetRevision ValueHolder

-- | The UUID (represented in Base62-encoded text) of the document to be
--   verified.
getRevision_documentId :: Lens' GetRevision Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newGetRevisionResponse</a> smart constructor.
data GetRevisionResponse
GetRevisionResponse' :: Maybe (Sensitive ValueHolder) -> Int -> Sensitive ValueHolder -> GetRevisionResponse

-- | The proof object in Amazon Ion format returned by a
--   <tt>GetRevision</tt> request. A proof contains the list of hash values
--   that are required to recalculate the specified digest using a Merkle
--   tree, starting with the specified document revision.
[$sel:proof:GetRevisionResponse'] :: GetRevisionResponse -> Maybe (Sensitive ValueHolder)

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:GetRevisionResponse'] :: GetRevisionResponse -> Int

-- | The document revision data object in Amazon Ion format.
[$sel:revision:GetRevisionResponse'] :: GetRevisionResponse -> Sensitive ValueHolder

-- | Create a value of <a>GetRevisionResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:proof:GetRevisionResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getRevisionResponse_proof</a> - The proof object in Amazon Ion
--   format returned by a <tt>GetRevision</tt> request. A proof contains
--   the list of hash values that are required to recalculate the specified
--   digest using a Merkle tree, starting with the specified document
--   revision.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:GetRevisionResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getRevisionResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
--   
--   <a>$sel:revision:GetRevisionResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getRevisionResponse_revision</a> - The document revision data
--   object in Amazon Ion format.
newGetRevisionResponse :: Int -> ValueHolder -> GetRevisionResponse

-- | The proof object in Amazon Ion format returned by a
--   <tt>GetRevision</tt> request. A proof contains the list of hash values
--   that are required to recalculate the specified digest using a Merkle
--   tree, starting with the specified document revision.
getRevisionResponse_proof :: Lens' GetRevisionResponse (Maybe ValueHolder)

-- | The response's http status code.
getRevisionResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' GetRevisionResponse Int

-- | The document revision data object in Amazon Ion format.
getRevisionResponse_revision :: Lens' GetRevisionResponse ValueHolder
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.QLDB.GetRevision.GetRevision
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.QLDB.GetRevision.GetRevision
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.QLDB.GetRevision.GetRevision
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.QLDB.GetRevision.GetRevisionResponse
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.QLDB.GetRevision.GetRevisionResponse
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.QLDB.GetRevision.GetRevisionResponse
instance Network.AWS.Types.AWSRequest Network.AWS.QLDB.GetRevision.GetRevision
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.QLDB.GetRevision.GetRevisionResponse
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.QLDB.GetRevision.GetRevision
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.QLDB.GetRevision.GetRevision
instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeaders Network.AWS.QLDB.GetRevision.GetRevision
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.QLDB.GetRevision.GetRevision
instance Network.AWS.Data.Path.ToPath Network.AWS.QLDB.GetRevision.GetRevision
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.QLDB.GetRevision.GetRevision


-- | Returns the digest of a ledger at the latest committed block in the
--   journal. The response includes a 256-bit hash value and a block
--   address.
module Network.AWS.QLDB.GetDigest

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newGetDigest</a> smart constructor.
data GetDigest
GetDigest' :: Text -> GetDigest

-- | The name of the ledger.
[$sel:name:GetDigest'] :: GetDigest -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>GetDigest</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:GetDigest'</a>, <a>getDigest_name</a> - The name of the
--   ledger.
newGetDigest :: Text -> GetDigest

-- | The name of the ledger.
getDigest_name :: Lens' GetDigest Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newGetDigestResponse</a> smart constructor.
data GetDigestResponse
GetDigestResponse' :: Int -> Base64 -> Sensitive ValueHolder -> GetDigestResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:GetDigestResponse'] :: GetDigestResponse -> Int

-- | The 256-bit hash value representing the digest returned by a
--   <tt>GetDigest</tt> request.
[$sel:digest:GetDigestResponse'] :: GetDigestResponse -> Base64

-- | The latest block location covered by the digest that you requested. An
--   address is an Amazon Ion structure that has two fields:
--   <tt>strandId</tt> and <tt>sequenceNo</tt>.
[$sel:digestTipAddress:GetDigestResponse'] :: GetDigestResponse -> Sensitive ValueHolder

-- | Create a value of <a>GetDigestResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:GetDigestResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getDigestResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status code.
--   
--   <a>$sel:digest:GetDigestResponse'</a>, <a>getDigestResponse_digest</a>
--   - The 256-bit hash value representing the digest returned by a
--   <tt>GetDigest</tt> request.-- -- <i>Note:</i> This <tt>Lens</tt>
--   automatically encodes and decodes Base64 data. -- The underlying
--   isomorphism will encode to Base64 representation during --
--   serialisation, and decode from Base64 representation during
--   deserialisation. -- This <tt>Lens</tt> accepts and returns only raw
--   unencoded data.
--   
--   <a>$sel:digestTipAddress:GetDigestResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getDigestResponse_digestTipAddress</a> - The latest block location
--   covered by the digest that you requested. An address is an Amazon Ion
--   structure that has two fields: <tt>strandId</tt> and
--   <tt>sequenceNo</tt>.
newGetDigestResponse :: Int -> ByteString -> ValueHolder -> GetDigestResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
getDigestResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' GetDigestResponse Int

-- | The 256-bit hash value representing the digest returned by a
--   <tt>GetDigest</tt> request.-- -- <i>Note:</i> This <tt>Lens</tt>
--   automatically encodes and decodes Base64 data. -- The underlying
--   isomorphism will encode to Base64 representation during --
--   serialisation, and decode from Base64 representation during
--   deserialisation. -- This <tt>Lens</tt> accepts and returns only raw
--   unencoded data.
getDigestResponse_digest :: Lens' GetDigestResponse ByteString

-- | The latest block location covered by the digest that you requested. An
--   address is an Amazon Ion structure that has two fields:
--   <tt>strandId</tt> and <tt>sequenceNo</tt>.
getDigestResponse_digestTipAddress :: Lens' GetDigestResponse ValueHolder
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.QLDB.GetDigest.GetDigest
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.QLDB.GetDigest.GetDigest
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.QLDB.GetDigest.GetDigest
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.QLDB.GetDigest.GetDigest
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.QLDB.GetDigest.GetDigestResponse
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.QLDB.GetDigest.GetDigestResponse
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.QLDB.GetDigest.GetDigestResponse
instance Network.AWS.Types.AWSRequest Network.AWS.QLDB.GetDigest.GetDigest
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.QLDB.GetDigest.GetDigestResponse
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.QLDB.GetDigest.GetDigest
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.QLDB.GetDigest.GetDigest
instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeaders Network.AWS.QLDB.GetDigest.GetDigest
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.QLDB.GetDigest.GetDigest
instance Network.AWS.Data.Path.ToPath Network.AWS.QLDB.GetDigest.GetDigest
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.QLDB.GetDigest.GetDigest


-- | Returns a block object at a specified address in a journal. Also
--   returns a proof of the specified block for verification if
--   <tt>DigestTipAddress</tt> is provided.
--   
--   For information about the data contents in a block, see <a>Journal
--   contents</a> in the <i>Amazon QLDB Developer Guide</i>.
--   
--   If the specified ledger doesn't exist or is in <tt>DELETING</tt>
--   status, then throws <tt>ResourceNotFoundException</tt>.
--   
--   If the specified ledger is in <tt>CREATING</tt> status, then throws
--   <tt>ResourcePreconditionNotMetException</tt>.
--   
--   If no block exists with the specified address, then throws
--   <tt>InvalidParameterException</tt>.
module Network.AWS.QLDB.GetBlock

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newGetBlock</a> smart constructor.
data GetBlock
GetBlock' :: Maybe (Sensitive ValueHolder) -> Text -> Sensitive ValueHolder -> GetBlock

-- | The latest block location covered by the digest for which to request a
--   proof. An address is an Amazon Ion structure that has two fields:
--   <tt>strandId</tt> and <tt>sequenceNo</tt>.
--   
--   For example:
--   <tt>{strandId:"BlFTjlSXze9BIh1KOszcE3",sequenceNo:49}</tt>.
[$sel:digestTipAddress:GetBlock'] :: GetBlock -> Maybe (Sensitive ValueHolder)

-- | The name of the ledger.
[$sel:name:GetBlock'] :: GetBlock -> Text

-- | The location of the block that you want to request. An address is an
--   Amazon Ion structure that has two fields: <tt>strandId</tt> and
--   <tt>sequenceNo</tt>.
--   
--   For example:
--   <tt>{strandId:"BlFTjlSXze9BIh1KOszcE3",sequenceNo:14}</tt>.
[$sel:blockAddress:GetBlock'] :: GetBlock -> Sensitive ValueHolder

-- | Create a value of <a>GetBlock</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:digestTipAddress:GetBlock'</a>,
--   <a>getBlock_digestTipAddress</a> - The latest block location covered
--   by the digest for which to request a proof. An address is an Amazon
--   Ion structure that has two fields: <tt>strandId</tt> and
--   <tt>sequenceNo</tt>.
--   
--   For example:
--   <tt>{strandId:"BlFTjlSXze9BIh1KOszcE3",sequenceNo:49}</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:GetBlock'</a>, <a>getBlock_name</a> - The name of the
--   ledger.
--   
--   <a>$sel:blockAddress:GetBlock'</a>, <a>getBlock_blockAddress</a> - The
--   location of the block that you want to request. An address is an
--   Amazon Ion structure that has two fields: <tt>strandId</tt> and
--   <tt>sequenceNo</tt>.
--   
--   For example:
--   <tt>{strandId:"BlFTjlSXze9BIh1KOszcE3",sequenceNo:14}</tt>.
newGetBlock :: Text -> ValueHolder -> GetBlock

-- | The latest block location covered by the digest for which to request a
--   proof. An address is an Amazon Ion structure that has two fields:
--   <tt>strandId</tt> and <tt>sequenceNo</tt>.
--   
--   For example:
--   <tt>{strandId:"BlFTjlSXze9BIh1KOszcE3",sequenceNo:49}</tt>.
getBlock_digestTipAddress :: Lens' GetBlock (Maybe ValueHolder)

-- | The name of the ledger.
getBlock_name :: Lens' GetBlock Text

-- | The location of the block that you want to request. An address is an
--   Amazon Ion structure that has two fields: <tt>strandId</tt> and
--   <tt>sequenceNo</tt>.
--   
--   For example:
--   <tt>{strandId:"BlFTjlSXze9BIh1KOszcE3",sequenceNo:14}</tt>.
getBlock_blockAddress :: Lens' GetBlock ValueHolder

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newGetBlockResponse</a> smart constructor.
data GetBlockResponse
GetBlockResponse' :: Maybe (Sensitive ValueHolder) -> Int -> Sensitive ValueHolder -> GetBlockResponse

-- | The proof object in Amazon Ion format returned by a <tt>GetBlock</tt>
--   request. A proof contains the list of hash values required to
--   recalculate the specified digest using a Merkle tree, starting with
--   the specified block.
[$sel:proof:GetBlockResponse'] :: GetBlockResponse -> Maybe (Sensitive ValueHolder)

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:GetBlockResponse'] :: GetBlockResponse -> Int

-- | The block data object in Amazon Ion format.
[$sel:block:GetBlockResponse'] :: GetBlockResponse -> Sensitive ValueHolder

-- | Create a value of <a>GetBlockResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:proof:GetBlockResponse'</a>, <a>getBlockResponse_proof</a> -
--   The proof object in Amazon Ion format returned by a <tt>GetBlock</tt>
--   request. A proof contains the list of hash values required to
--   recalculate the specified digest using a Merkle tree, starting with
--   the specified block.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:GetBlockResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getBlockResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status code.
--   
--   <a>$sel:block:GetBlockResponse'</a>, <a>getBlockResponse_block</a> -
--   The block data object in Amazon Ion format.
newGetBlockResponse :: Int -> ValueHolder -> GetBlockResponse

-- | The proof object in Amazon Ion format returned by a <tt>GetBlock</tt>
--   request. A proof contains the list of hash values required to
--   recalculate the specified digest using a Merkle tree, starting with
--   the specified block.
getBlockResponse_proof :: Lens' GetBlockResponse (Maybe ValueHolder)

-- | The response's http status code.
getBlockResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' GetBlockResponse Int

-- | The block data object in Amazon Ion format.
getBlockResponse_block :: Lens' GetBlockResponse ValueHolder
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.QLDB.GetBlock.GetBlock
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.QLDB.GetBlock.GetBlock
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.QLDB.GetBlock.GetBlock
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.QLDB.GetBlock.GetBlockResponse
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.QLDB.GetBlock.GetBlockResponse
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.QLDB.GetBlock.GetBlockResponse
instance Network.AWS.Types.AWSRequest Network.AWS.QLDB.GetBlock.GetBlock
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.QLDB.GetBlock.GetBlockResponse
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.QLDB.GetBlock.GetBlock
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.QLDB.GetBlock.GetBlock
instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeaders Network.AWS.QLDB.GetBlock.GetBlock
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.QLDB.GetBlock.GetBlock
instance Network.AWS.Data.Path.ToPath Network.AWS.QLDB.GetBlock.GetBlock
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.QLDB.GetBlock.GetBlock


-- | Exports journal contents within a date and time range from a ledger
--   into a specified Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) bucket. The
--   data is written as files in Amazon Ion format.
--   
--   If the ledger with the given <tt>Name</tt> doesn't exist, then throws
--   <tt>ResourceNotFoundException</tt>.
--   
--   If the ledger with the given <tt>Name</tt> is in <tt>CREATING</tt>
--   status, then throws <tt>ResourcePreconditionNotMetException</tt>.
--   
--   You can initiate up to two concurrent journal export requests for each
--   ledger. Beyond this limit, journal export requests throw
--   <tt>LimitExceededException</tt>.
module Network.AWS.QLDB.ExportJournalToS3

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newExportJournalToS3</a> smart constructor.
data ExportJournalToS3
ExportJournalToS3' :: Text -> POSIX -> POSIX -> S3ExportConfiguration -> Text -> ExportJournalToS3

-- | The name of the ledger.
[$sel:name:ExportJournalToS3'] :: ExportJournalToS3 -> Text

-- | The inclusive start date and time for the range of journal contents to
--   export.
--   
--   The <tt>InclusiveStartTime</tt> must be in <tt>ISO 8601</tt> date and
--   time format and in Universal Coordinated Time (UTC). For example:
--   <tt>2019-06-13T21:36:34Z</tt>.
--   
--   The <tt>InclusiveStartTime</tt> must be before
--   <tt>ExclusiveEndTime</tt>.
--   
--   If you provide an <tt>InclusiveStartTime</tt> that is before the
--   ledger's <tt>CreationDateTime</tt>, Amazon QLDB defaults it to the
--   ledger's <tt>CreationDateTime</tt>.
[$sel:inclusiveStartTime:ExportJournalToS3'] :: ExportJournalToS3 -> POSIX

-- | The exclusive end date and time for the range of journal contents to
--   export.
--   
--   The <tt>ExclusiveEndTime</tt> must be in <tt>ISO 8601</tt> date and
--   time format and in Universal Coordinated Time (UTC). For example:
--   <tt>2019-06-13T21:36:34Z</tt>.
--   
--   The <tt>ExclusiveEndTime</tt> must be less than or equal to the
--   current UTC date and time.
[$sel:exclusiveEndTime:ExportJournalToS3'] :: ExportJournalToS3 -> POSIX

-- | The configuration settings of the Amazon S3 bucket destination for
--   your export request.
[$sel:s3ExportConfiguration:ExportJournalToS3'] :: ExportJournalToS3 -> S3ExportConfiguration

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that grants QLDB
--   permissions for a journal export job to do the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Write objects into your Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3)
--   bucket.</li>
--   <li>(Optional) Use your customer master key (CMK) in Key Management
--   Service (KMS) for server-side encryption of your exported data.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:roleArn:ExportJournalToS3'] :: ExportJournalToS3 -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ExportJournalToS3</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:ExportJournalToS3'</a>, <a>exportJournalToS3_name</a> -
--   The name of the ledger.
--   
--   <a>$sel:inclusiveStartTime:ExportJournalToS3'</a>,
--   <a>exportJournalToS3_inclusiveStartTime</a> - The inclusive start date
--   and time for the range of journal contents to export.
--   
--   The <tt>InclusiveStartTime</tt> must be in <tt>ISO 8601</tt> date and
--   time format and in Universal Coordinated Time (UTC). For example:
--   <tt>2019-06-13T21:36:34Z</tt>.
--   
--   The <tt>InclusiveStartTime</tt> must be before
--   <tt>ExclusiveEndTime</tt>.
--   
--   If you provide an <tt>InclusiveStartTime</tt> that is before the
--   ledger's <tt>CreationDateTime</tt>, Amazon QLDB defaults it to the
--   ledger's <tt>CreationDateTime</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:exclusiveEndTime:ExportJournalToS3'</a>,
--   <a>exportJournalToS3_exclusiveEndTime</a> - The exclusive end date and
--   time for the range of journal contents to export.
--   
--   The <tt>ExclusiveEndTime</tt> must be in <tt>ISO 8601</tt> date and
--   time format and in Universal Coordinated Time (UTC). For example:
--   <tt>2019-06-13T21:36:34Z</tt>.
--   
--   The <tt>ExclusiveEndTime</tt> must be less than or equal to the
--   current UTC date and time.
--   
--   <a>$sel:s3ExportConfiguration:ExportJournalToS3'</a>,
--   <a>exportJournalToS3_s3ExportConfiguration</a> - The configuration
--   settings of the Amazon S3 bucket destination for your export request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleArn:ExportJournalToS3'</a>,
--   <a>exportJournalToS3_roleArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of
--   the IAM role that grants QLDB permissions for a journal export job to
--   do the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Write objects into your Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3)
--   bucket.</li>
--   <li>(Optional) Use your customer master key (CMK) in Key Management
--   Service (KMS) for server-side encryption of your exported data.</li>
--   </ul>
newExportJournalToS3 :: Text -> UTCTime -> UTCTime -> S3ExportConfiguration -> Text -> ExportJournalToS3

-- | The name of the ledger.
exportJournalToS3_name :: Lens' ExportJournalToS3 Text

-- | The inclusive start date and time for the range of journal contents to
--   export.
--   
--   The <tt>InclusiveStartTime</tt> must be in <tt>ISO 8601</tt> date and
--   time format and in Universal Coordinated Time (UTC). For example:
--   <tt>2019-06-13T21:36:34Z</tt>.
--   
--   The <tt>InclusiveStartTime</tt> must be before
--   <tt>ExclusiveEndTime</tt>.
--   
--   If you provide an <tt>InclusiveStartTime</tt> that is before the
--   ledger's <tt>CreationDateTime</tt>, Amazon QLDB defaults it to the
--   ledger's <tt>CreationDateTime</tt>.
exportJournalToS3_inclusiveStartTime :: Lens' ExportJournalToS3 UTCTime

-- | The exclusive end date and time for the range of journal contents to
--   export.
--   
--   The <tt>ExclusiveEndTime</tt> must be in <tt>ISO 8601</tt> date and
--   time format and in Universal Coordinated Time (UTC). For example:
--   <tt>2019-06-13T21:36:34Z</tt>.
--   
--   The <tt>ExclusiveEndTime</tt> must be less than or equal to the
--   current UTC date and time.
exportJournalToS3_exclusiveEndTime :: Lens' ExportJournalToS3 UTCTime

-- | The configuration settings of the Amazon S3 bucket destination for
--   your export request.
exportJournalToS3_s3ExportConfiguration :: Lens' ExportJournalToS3 S3ExportConfiguration

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that grants QLDB
--   permissions for a journal export job to do the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Write objects into your Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3)
--   bucket.</li>
--   <li>(Optional) Use your customer master key (CMK) in Key Management
--   Service (KMS) for server-side encryption of your exported data.</li>
--   </ul>
exportJournalToS3_roleArn :: Lens' ExportJournalToS3 Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newExportJournalToS3Response</a> smart constructor.
data ExportJournalToS3Response
ExportJournalToS3Response' :: Int -> Text -> ExportJournalToS3Response

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:ExportJournalToS3Response'] :: ExportJournalToS3Response -> Int

-- | The UUID (represented in Base62-encoded text) that QLDB assigns to
--   each journal export job.
--   
--   To describe your export request and check the status of the job, you
--   can use <tt>ExportId</tt> to call <tt>DescribeJournalS3Export</tt>.
[$sel:exportId:ExportJournalToS3Response'] :: ExportJournalToS3Response -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ExportJournalToS3Response</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:ExportJournalToS3Response'</a>,
--   <a>exportJournalToS3Response_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.
--   
--   <a>$sel:exportId:ExportJournalToS3Response'</a>,
--   <a>exportJournalToS3Response_exportId</a> - The UUID (represented in
--   Base62-encoded text) that QLDB assigns to each journal export job.
--   
--   To describe your export request and check the status of the job, you
--   can use <tt>ExportId</tt> to call <tt>DescribeJournalS3Export</tt>.
newExportJournalToS3Response :: Int -> Text -> ExportJournalToS3Response

-- | The response's http status code.
exportJournalToS3Response_httpStatus :: Lens' ExportJournalToS3Response Int

-- | The UUID (represented in Base62-encoded text) that QLDB assigns to
--   each journal export job.
--   
--   To describe your export request and check the status of the job, you
--   can use <tt>ExportId</tt> to call <tt>DescribeJournalS3Export</tt>.
exportJournalToS3Response_exportId :: Lens' ExportJournalToS3Response Text

instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.QLDB.ExportJournalToS3.ExportJournalToS3
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.QLDB.ExportJournalToS3.ExportJournalToS3
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.QLDB.ExportJournalToS3.ExportJournalToS3
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.QLDB.ExportJournalToS3.ExportJournalToS3Response
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.QLDB.ExportJournalToS3.ExportJournalToS3Response
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.QLDB.ExportJournalToS3.ExportJournalToS3Response

-- | Returns information about a ledger, including its state, permissions
--   mode, encryption at rest settings, and when it was created.
module Network.AWS.QLDB.DescribeLedger

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeLedger</a> smart constructor.
data DescribeLedger
DescribeLedger' :: Text -> DescribeLedger

-- | The name of the ledger that you want to describe.
[$sel:name:DescribeLedger'] :: DescribeLedger -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeLedger</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:DescribeLedger'</a>, <a>describeLedger_name</a> - The
--   name of the ledger that you want to describe.
newDescribeLedger :: Text -> DescribeLedger

-- | The name of the ledger that you want to describe.
describeLedger_name :: Lens' DescribeLedger Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeLedgerResponse</a> smart constructor.
data DescribeLedgerResponse
DescribeLedgerResponse' :: Maybe LedgerState -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe LedgerEncryptionDescription -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe PermissionsMode -> Int -> DescribeLedgerResponse

-- | The current status of the ledger.
[$sel:state:DescribeLedgerResponse'] :: DescribeLedgerResponse -> Maybe LedgerState

-- | The flag that prevents a ledger from being deleted by any user. If not
--   provided on ledger creation, this feature is enabled (<tt>true</tt>)
--   by default.
--   
--   If deletion protection is enabled, you must first disable it before
--   you can delete the ledger. You can disable it by calling the
--   <tt>UpdateLedger</tt> operation to set the flag to <tt>false</tt>.
[$sel:deletionProtection:DescribeLedgerResponse'] :: DescribeLedgerResponse -> Maybe Bool

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the ledger.
[$sel:arn:DescribeLedgerResponse'] :: DescribeLedgerResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | Information about the encryption of data at rest in the ledger. This
--   includes the current status, the KMS key, and when the key became
--   inaccessible (in the case of an error).
[$sel:encryptionDescription:DescribeLedgerResponse'] :: DescribeLedgerResponse -> Maybe LedgerEncryptionDescription

-- | The name of the ledger.
[$sel:name:DescribeLedgerResponse'] :: DescribeLedgerResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The date and time, in epoch time format, when the ledger was created.
--   (Epoch time format is the number of seconds elapsed since 12:00:00 AM
--   January 1, 1970 UTC.)
[$sel:creationDateTime:DescribeLedgerResponse'] :: DescribeLedgerResponse -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The permissions mode of the ledger.
[$sel:permissionsMode:DescribeLedgerResponse'] :: DescribeLedgerResponse -> Maybe PermissionsMode

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:DescribeLedgerResponse'] :: DescribeLedgerResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeLedgerResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:state:DescribeLedgerResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeLedgerResponse_state</a> - The current status of the
--   ledger.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deletionProtection:DescribeLedgerResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeLedgerResponse_deletionProtection</a> - The flag that
--   prevents a ledger from being deleted by any user. If not provided on
--   ledger creation, this feature is enabled (<tt>true</tt>) by default.
--   
--   If deletion protection is enabled, you must first disable it before
--   you can delete the ledger. You can disable it by calling the
--   <tt>UpdateLedger</tt> operation to set the flag to <tt>false</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:DescribeLedgerResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeLedgerResponse_arn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for
--   the ledger.
--   
--   <a>$sel:encryptionDescription:DescribeLedgerResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeLedgerResponse_encryptionDescription</a> - Information
--   about the encryption of data at rest in the ledger. This includes the
--   current status, the KMS key, and when the key became inaccessible (in
--   the case of an error).
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:DescribeLedger'</a>, <a>describeLedgerResponse_name</a> -
--   The name of the ledger.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationDateTime:DescribeLedgerResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeLedgerResponse_creationDateTime</a> - The date and time, in
--   epoch time format, when the ledger was created. (Epoch time format is
--   the number of seconds elapsed since 12:00:00 AM January 1, 1970 UTC.)
--   
--   <a>$sel:permissionsMode:DescribeLedgerResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeLedgerResponse_permissionsMode</a> - The permissions mode
--   of the ledger.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:DescribeLedgerResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeLedgerResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
newDescribeLedgerResponse :: Int -> DescribeLedgerResponse

-- | The current status of the ledger.
describeLedgerResponse_state :: Lens' DescribeLedgerResponse (Maybe LedgerState)

-- | The flag that prevents a ledger from being deleted by any user. If not
--   provided on ledger creation, this feature is enabled (<tt>true</tt>)
--   by default.
--   
--   If deletion protection is enabled, you must first disable it before
--   you can delete the ledger. You can disable it by calling the
--   <tt>UpdateLedger</tt> operation to set the flag to <tt>false</tt>.
describeLedgerResponse_deletionProtection :: Lens' DescribeLedgerResponse (Maybe Bool)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the ledger.
describeLedgerResponse_arn :: Lens' DescribeLedgerResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | Information about the encryption of data at rest in the ledger. This
--   includes the current status, the KMS key, and when the key became
--   inaccessible (in the case of an error).
describeLedgerResponse_encryptionDescription :: Lens' DescribeLedgerResponse (Maybe LedgerEncryptionDescription)

-- | The name of the ledger.
describeLedgerResponse_name :: Lens' DescribeLedgerResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The date and time, in epoch time format, when the ledger was created.
--   (Epoch time format is the number of seconds elapsed since 12:00:00 AM
--   January 1, 1970 UTC.)
describeLedgerResponse_creationDateTime :: Lens' DescribeLedgerResponse (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The permissions mode of the ledger.
describeLedgerResponse_permissionsMode :: Lens' DescribeLedgerResponse (Maybe PermissionsMode)

-- | The response's http status code.
describeLedgerResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' DescribeLedgerResponse Int
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.QLDB.DescribeLedger.DescribeLedger
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.QLDB.DescribeLedger.DescribeLedger
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.QLDB.DescribeLedger.DescribeLedger
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.QLDB.DescribeLedger.DescribeLedger
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.QLDB.DescribeLedger.DescribeLedgerResponse
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.QLDB.DescribeLedger.DescribeLedgerResponse
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.QLDB.DescribeLedger.DescribeLedgerResponse
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.QLDB.DescribeLedger.DescribeLedgerResponse
instance Network.AWS.Types.AWSRequest Network.AWS.QLDB.DescribeLedger.DescribeLedger
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.QLDB.DescribeLedger.DescribeLedgerResponse
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.QLDB.DescribeLedger.DescribeLedger
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.QLDB.DescribeLedger.DescribeLedger
instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeaders Network.AWS.QLDB.DescribeLedger.DescribeLedger
instance Network.AWS.Data.Path.ToPath Network.AWS.QLDB.DescribeLedger.DescribeLedger
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.QLDB.DescribeLedger.DescribeLedger


-- | Returns information about a journal export job, including the ledger
--   name, export ID, creation time, current status, and the parameters of
--   the original export creation request.
--   
--   This action does not return any expired export jobs. For more
--   information, see <a>Export job expiration</a> in the <i>Amazon QLDB
--   Developer Guide</i>.
--   
--   If the export job with the given <tt>ExportId</tt> doesn't exist, then
--   throws <tt>ResourceNotFoundException</tt>.
--   
--   If the ledger with the given <tt>Name</tt> doesn't exist, then throws
--   <tt>ResourceNotFoundException</tt>.
module Network.AWS.QLDB.DescribeJournalS3Export

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeJournalS3Export</a> smart constructor.
data DescribeJournalS3Export
DescribeJournalS3Export' :: Text -> Text -> DescribeJournalS3Export

-- | The name of the ledger.
[$sel:name:DescribeJournalS3Export'] :: DescribeJournalS3Export -> Text

-- | The UUID (represented in Base62-encoded text) of the journal export
--   job to describe.
[$sel:exportId:DescribeJournalS3Export'] :: DescribeJournalS3Export -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeJournalS3Export</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:DescribeJournalS3Export'</a>,
--   <a>describeJournalS3Export_name</a> - The name of the ledger.
--   
--   <a>$sel:exportId:DescribeJournalS3Export'</a>,
--   <a>describeJournalS3Export_exportId</a> - The UUID (represented in
--   Base62-encoded text) of the journal export job to describe.
newDescribeJournalS3Export :: Text -> Text -> DescribeJournalS3Export

-- | The name of the ledger.
describeJournalS3Export_name :: Lens' DescribeJournalS3Export Text

-- | The UUID (represented in Base62-encoded text) of the journal export
--   job to describe.
describeJournalS3Export_exportId :: Lens' DescribeJournalS3Export Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeJournalS3ExportResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.
data DescribeJournalS3ExportResponse
DescribeJournalS3ExportResponse' :: Int -> JournalS3ExportDescription -> DescribeJournalS3ExportResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:DescribeJournalS3ExportResponse'] :: DescribeJournalS3ExportResponse -> Int

-- | Information about the journal export job returned by a
--   <tt>DescribeJournalS3Export</tt> request.
[$sel:exportDescription:DescribeJournalS3ExportResponse'] :: DescribeJournalS3ExportResponse -> JournalS3ExportDescription

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeJournalS3ExportResponse</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:DescribeJournalS3ExportResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeJournalS3ExportResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's
--   http status code.
--   
--   <a>$sel:exportDescription:DescribeJournalS3ExportResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeJournalS3ExportResponse_exportDescription</a> - Information
--   about the journal export job returned by a
--   <tt>DescribeJournalS3Export</tt> request.
newDescribeJournalS3ExportResponse :: Int -> JournalS3ExportDescription -> DescribeJournalS3ExportResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
describeJournalS3ExportResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' DescribeJournalS3ExportResponse Int

-- | Information about the journal export job returned by a
--   <tt>DescribeJournalS3Export</tt> request.
describeJournalS3ExportResponse_exportDescription :: Lens' DescribeJournalS3ExportResponse JournalS3ExportDescription
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.QLDB.DescribeJournalS3Export.DescribeJournalS3Export
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.QLDB.DescribeJournalS3Export.DescribeJournalS3Export
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.QLDB.DescribeJournalS3Export.DescribeJournalS3Export
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.QLDB.DescribeJournalS3Export.DescribeJournalS3Export

instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.QLDB.DescribeJournalS3Export.DescribeJournalS3ExportResponse

-- | Returns detailed information about a given Amazon QLDB journal stream.
--   The output includes the Amazon Resource Name (ARN), stream name,
--   current status, creation time, and the parameters of the original
--   stream creation request.
--   
--   This action does not return any expired journal streams. For more
--   information, see <a>Expiration for terminal streams</a> in the
--   <i>Amazon QLDB Developer Guide</i>.
module Network.AWS.QLDB.DescribeJournalKinesisStream

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeJournalKinesisStream</a> smart constructor.
data DescribeJournalKinesisStream
DescribeJournalKinesisStream' :: Text -> Text -> DescribeJournalKinesisStream

-- | The name of the ledger.
[$sel:ledgerName:DescribeJournalKinesisStream'] :: DescribeJournalKinesisStream -> Text

-- | The UUID (represented in Base62-encoded text) of the QLDB journal
--   stream to describe.

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeJournalKinesisStream</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   ledger.
--   
--   <a>$sel:streamId:DescribeJournalKinesisStream'</a>,
--   <a>describeJournalKinesisStream_streamId</a> - The UUID (represented
--   in Base62-encoded text) of the QLDB journal stream to describe.

--   stream to describe.

-- | Deletes a ledger and all of its contents. This action is irreversible.
--   
--   If deletion protection is enabled, you must first disable it before
--   you can delete the ledger. You can disable it by calling the
--   <tt>UpdateLedger</tt> operation to set the flag to <tt>false</tt>.
module Network.AWS.QLDB.DeleteLedger

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDeleteLedger</a> smart constructor.
data DeleteLedger
DeleteLedger' :: Text -> DeleteLedger

-- | The name of the ledger that you want to delete.
[$sel:name:DeleteLedger'] :: DeleteLedger -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DeleteLedger</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:DeleteLedger'</a>, <a>deleteLedger_name</a> - The name of
--   the ledger that you want to delete.
newDeleteLedger :: Text -> DeleteLedger

-- | The name of the ledger that you want to delete.
deleteLedger_name :: Lens' DeleteLedger Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDeleteLedgerResponse</a> smart constructor.
data DeleteLedgerResponse
DeleteLedgerResponse' :: DeleteLedgerResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>DeleteLedgerResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
newDeleteLedgerResponse :: DeleteLedgerResponse

instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.QLDB.DeleteLedger.DeleteLedger
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.QLDB.DeleteLedger.DeleteLedger

instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.QLDB.DeleteLedger.DeleteLedgerResponse

instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.QLDB.DeleteLedger.DeleteLedger


-- | Creates a new ledger in your account in the current Region.
module Network.AWS.QLDB.CreateLedger

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateLedger</a> smart constructor.
data CreateLedger
CreateLedger' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Text -> PermissionsMode -> CreateLedger

-- | The flag that prevents a ledger from being deleted by any user. If not
--   provided on ledger creation, this feature is enabled (<tt>true</tt>)
--   by default.
--   
--   If deletion protection is enabled, you must first disable it before
--   you can delete the ledger. You can disable it by calling the
--   <tt>UpdateLedger</tt> operation to set the flag to <tt>false</tt>.
[$sel:deletionProtection:CreateLedger'] :: CreateLedger -> Maybe Bool

-- | The key in Key Management Service (KMS) to use for encryption of data
--   at rest in the ledger. For more information, see <a>Encryption at
--   rest</a> in the <i>Amazon QLDB Developer Guide</i>.
--   
--   Use one of the following options to specify this parameter:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>AWS_OWNED_KMS_KEY</tt>: Use an KMS key that is owned and
--   managed by Amazon Web Services on your behalf.</li>
--   <li><b>Undefined</b>: By default, use an Amazon Web Services owned KMS
--   key.</li>
--   <li><b>A valid symmetric customer managed KMS key</b>: Use the
--   specified KMS key in your account that you create, own, and
--   manage.Amazon QLDB does not support asymmetric keys. For more
--   information, see <a>Using symmetric and asymmetric keys</a> in the
--   <i>Key Management Service Developer Guide</i>.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   To specify a customer managed KMS key, you can use its key ID, Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN), alias name, or alias ARN. When using an alias
--   name, prefix it with <tt>"alias/"</tt>. To specify a key in a
--   different account, you must use the key ARN or alias ARN.
--   
--   For example:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Key ID: <tt>1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab</tt></li>
--   <li>Key ARN:
--   <tt>arn:aws:kms:us-east-2:111122223333:key/1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab</tt></li>
--   <li>Alias name: <tt>alias/ExampleAlias</tt></li>
--   <li>Alias ARN:
--   <tt>arn:aws:kms:us-east-2:111122223333:alias/ExampleAlias</tt></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Key identifiers (KeyId)</a> in the <i>Key
--   Management Service Developer Guide</i>.
[$sel:kmsKey:CreateLedger'] :: CreateLedger -> Maybe Text

-- | The key-value pairs to add as tags to the ledger that you want to
--   create. Tag keys are case sensitive. Tag values are case sensitive and
--   can be null.
[$sel:tags:CreateLedger'] :: CreateLedger -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The name of the ledger that you want to create. The name must be
--   unique among all of the ledgers in your account in the current Region.
--   
--   Naming constraints for ledger names are defined in <a>Quotas in Amazon
--   QLDB</a> in the <i>Amazon QLDB Developer Guide</i>.
[$sel:name:CreateLedger'] :: CreateLedger -> Text

-- | The permissions mode to assign to the ledger that you want to create.
--   This parameter can have one of the following values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>ALLOW_ALL</tt>: A legacy permissions mode that enables access
--   control with API-level granularity for ledgers.This mode allows users
--   who have the <tt>SendCommand</tt> API permission for this ledger to
--   run all PartiQL commands (hence, <tt>ALLOW_ALL</tt>) on any tables in
--   the specified ledger. This mode disregards any table-level or
--   command-level IAM permissions policies that you create for the
--   ledger.</li>
--   <li><tt>STANDARD</tt>: (<i>Recommended</i>) A permissions mode that
--   enables access control with finer granularity for ledgers, tables, and
--   PartiQL commands.By default, this mode denies all user requests to run
--   any PartiQL commands on any tables in this ledger. To allow PartiQL
--   commands to run, you must create IAM permissions policies for specific
--   table resources and PartiQL actions, in addition to the
--   <tt>SendCommand</tt> API permission for the ledger. For information,
--   see <a>Getting started with the standard permissions mode</a> in the
--   <i>Amazon QLDB Developer Guide</i>.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   We strongly recommend using the <tt>STANDARD</tt> permissions mode to
--   maximize the security of your ledger data.
[$sel:permissionsMode:CreateLedger'] :: CreateLedger -> PermissionsMode

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateLedger</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:deletionProtection:CreateLedger'</a>,
--   <a>createLedger_deletionProtection</a> - The flag that prevents a
--   ledger from being deleted by any user. If not provided on ledger
--   creation, this feature is enabled (<tt>true</tt>) by default.
--   
--   If deletion protection is enabled, you must first disable it before
--   you can delete the ledger. You can disable it by calling the
--   <tt>UpdateLedger</tt> operation to set the flag to <tt>false</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kmsKey:CreateLedger'</a>, <a>createLedger_kmsKey</a> - The key
--   in Key Management Service (KMS) to use for encryption of data at rest
--   in the ledger. For more information, see <a>Encryption at rest</a> in
--   the <i>Amazon QLDB Developer Guide</i>.
--   
--   Use one of the following options to specify this parameter:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>AWS_OWNED_KMS_KEY</tt>: Use an KMS key that is owned and
--   managed by Amazon Web Services on your behalf.</li>
--   <li><b>Undefined</b>: By default, use an Amazon Web Services owned KMS
--   key.</li>
--   <li><b>A valid symmetric customer managed KMS key</b>: Use the
--   specified KMS key in your account that you create, own, and
--   manage.Amazon QLDB does not support asymmetric keys. For more
--   information, see <a>Using symmetric and asymmetric keys</a> in the
--   <i>Key Management Service Developer Guide</i>.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   To specify a customer managed KMS key, you can use its key ID, Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN), alias name, or alias ARN. When using an alias
--   name, prefix it with <tt>"alias/"</tt>. To specify a key in a
--   different account, you must use the key ARN or alias ARN.
--   
--   For example:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Key ID: <tt>1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab</tt></li>
--   <li>Key ARN:
--   <tt>arn:aws:kms:us-east-2:111122223333:key/1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab</tt></li>
--   <li>Alias name: <tt>alias/ExampleAlias</tt></li>
--   <li>Alias ARN:
--   <tt>arn:aws:kms:us-east-2:111122223333:alias/ExampleAlias</tt></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Key identifiers (KeyId)</a> in the <i>Key
--   Management Service Developer Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:CreateLedger'</a>, <a>createLedger_tags</a> - The
--   key-value pairs to add as tags to the ledger that you want to create.
--   Tag keys are case sensitive. Tag values are case sensitive and can be
--   null.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:CreateLedger'</a>, <a>createLedger_name</a> - The name of
--   the ledger that you want to create. The name must be unique among all
--   of the ledgers in your account in the current Region.
--   
--   Naming constraints for ledger names are defined in <a>Quotas in Amazon
--   QLDB</a> in the <i>Amazon QLDB Developer Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:permissionsMode:CreateLedger'</a>,
--   <a>createLedger_permissionsMode</a> - The permissions mode to assign
--   to the ledger that you want to create. This parameter can have one of
--   the following values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>ALLOW_ALL</tt>: A legacy permissions mode that enables access
--   control with API-level granularity for ledgers.This mode allows users
--   who have the <tt>SendCommand</tt> API permission for this ledger to
--   run all PartiQL commands (hence, <tt>ALLOW_ALL</tt>) on any tables in
--   the specified ledger. This mode disregards any table-level or
--   command-level IAM permissions policies that you create for the
--   ledger.</li>
--   <li><tt>STANDARD</tt>: (<i>Recommended</i>) A permissions mode that
--   enables access control with finer granularity for ledgers, tables, and
--   PartiQL commands.By default, this mode denies all user requests to run
--   any PartiQL commands on any tables in this ledger. To allow PartiQL
--   commands to run, you must create IAM permissions policies for specific
--   table resources and PartiQL actions, in addition to the
--   <tt>SendCommand</tt> API permission for the ledger. For information,
--   see <a>Getting started with the standard permissions mode</a> in the
--   <i>Amazon QLDB Developer Guide</i>.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   We strongly recommend using the <tt>STANDARD</tt> permissions mode to
--   maximize the security of your ledger data.
newCreateLedger :: Text -> PermissionsMode -> CreateLedger

-- | The flag that prevents a ledger from being deleted by any user. If not
--   provided on ledger creation, this feature is enabled (<tt>true</tt>)
--   by default.
--   
--   If deletion protection is enabled, you must first disable it before
--   you can delete the ledger. You can disable it by calling the
--   <tt>UpdateLedger</tt> operation to set the flag to <tt>false</tt>.
createLedger_deletionProtection :: Lens' CreateLedger (Maybe Bool)

-- | The key in Key Management Service (KMS) to use for encryption of data
--   at rest in the ledger. For more information, see <a>Encryption at
--   rest</a> in the <i>Amazon QLDB Developer Guide</i>.
--   
--   Use one of the following options to specify this parameter:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>AWS_OWNED_KMS_KEY</tt>: Use an KMS key that is owned and
--   managed by Amazon Web Services on your behalf.</li>
--   <li><b>Undefined</b>: By default, use an Amazon Web Services owned KMS
--   key.</li>
--   <li><b>A valid symmetric customer managed KMS key</b>: Use the
--   specified KMS key in your account that you create, own, and
--   manage.Amazon QLDB does not support asymmetric keys. For more
--   information, see <a>Using symmetric and asymmetric keys</a> in the
--   <i>Key Management Service Developer Guide</i>.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   To specify a customer managed KMS key, you can use its key ID, Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN), alias name, or alias ARN. When using an alias
--   name, prefix it with <tt>"alias/"</tt>. To specify a key in a
--   different account, you must use the key ARN or alias ARN.
--   
--   For example:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Key ID: <tt>1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab</tt></li>
--   <li>Key ARN:
--   <tt>arn:aws:kms:us-east-2:111122223333:key/1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab</tt></li>
--   <li>Alias name: <tt>alias/ExampleAlias</tt></li>
--   <li>Alias ARN:
--   <tt>arn:aws:kms:us-east-2:111122223333:alias/ExampleAlias</tt></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Key identifiers (KeyId)</a> in the <i>Key
--   Management Service Developer Guide</i>.
createLedger_kmsKey :: Lens' CreateLedger (Maybe Text)

-- | The key-value pairs to add as tags to the ledger that you want to
--   create. Tag keys are case sensitive. Tag values are case sensitive and
--   can be null.
createLedger_tags :: Lens' CreateLedger (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | The name of the ledger that you want to create. The name must be
--   unique among all of the ledgers in your account in the current Region.
--   
--   Naming constraints for ledger names are defined in <a>Quotas in Amazon
--   QLDB</a> in the <i>Amazon QLDB Developer Guide</i>.
createLedger_name :: Lens' CreateLedger Text

-- | The permissions mode to assign to the ledger that you want to create.
--   This parameter can have one of the following values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>ALLOW_ALL</tt>: A legacy permissions mode that enables access
--   control with API-level granularity for ledgers.This mode allows users
--   who have the <tt>SendCommand</tt> API permission for this ledger to
--   run all PartiQL commands (hence, <tt>ALLOW_ALL</tt>) on any tables in
--   the specified ledger. This mode disregards any table-level or
--   command-level IAM permissions policies that you create for the
--   ledger.</li>
--   <li><tt>STANDARD</tt>: (<i>Recommended</i>) A permissions mode that
--   enables access control with finer granularity for ledgers, tables, and
--   PartiQL commands.By default, this mode denies all user requests to run
--   any PartiQL commands on any tables in this ledger. To allow PartiQL
--   commands to run, you must create IAM permissions policies for specific
--   table resources and PartiQL actions, in addition to the
--   <tt>SendCommand</tt> API permission for the ledger. For information,
--   see <a>Getting started with the standard permissions mode</a> in the
--   <i>Amazon QLDB Developer Guide</i>.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   We strongly recommend using the <tt>STANDARD</tt> permissions mode to
--   maximize the security of your ledger data.
createLedger_permissionsMode :: Lens' CreateLedger PermissionsMode

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateLedgerResponse</a> smart constructor.
data CreateLedgerResponse
CreateLedgerResponse' :: Maybe LedgerState -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe PermissionsMode -> Int -> CreateLedgerResponse

-- | The current status of the ledger.
[$sel:state:CreateLedgerResponse'] :: CreateLedgerResponse -> Maybe LedgerState

-- | The flag that prevents a ledger from being deleted by any user. If not
--   provided on ledger creation, this feature is enabled (<tt>true</tt>)
--   by default.
--   
--   If deletion protection is enabled, you must first disable it before
--   you can delete the ledger. You can disable it by calling the
--   <tt>UpdateLedger</tt> operation to set the flag to <tt>false</tt>.
[$sel:deletionProtection:CreateLedgerResponse'] :: CreateLedgerResponse -> Maybe Bool

-- | The ARN of the customer managed KMS key that the ledger uses for
--   encryption at rest. If this parameter is undefined, the ledger uses an
--   Amazon Web Services owned KMS key for encryption.
[$sel:kmsKeyArn:CreateLedgerResponse'] :: CreateLedgerResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the ledger.
[$sel:arn:CreateLedgerResponse'] :: CreateLedgerResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the ledger.
[$sel:name:CreateLedgerResponse'] :: CreateLedgerResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The date and time, in epoch time format, when the ledger was created.
--   (Epoch time format is the number of seconds elapsed since 12:00:00 AM
--   January 1, 1970 UTC.)
[$sel:creationDateTime:CreateLedgerResponse'] :: CreateLedgerResponse -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The permissions mode of the ledger that you created.
[$sel:permissionsMode:CreateLedgerResponse'] :: CreateLedgerResponse -> Maybe PermissionsMode

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:CreateLedgerResponse'] :: CreateLedgerResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateLedgerResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:state:CreateLedgerResponse'</a>,
--   <a>createLedgerResponse_state</a> - The current status of the ledger.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deletionProtection:CreateLedger'</a>,
--   <a>createLedgerResponse_deletionProtection</a> - The flag that
--   prevents a ledger from being deleted by any user. If not provided on
--   ledger creation, this feature is enabled (<tt>true</tt>) by default.
--   
--   If deletion protection is enabled, you must first disable it before
--   you can delete the ledger. You can disable it by calling the
--   <tt>UpdateLedger</tt> operation to set the flag to <tt>false</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kmsKeyArn:CreateLedgerResponse'</a>,
--   <a>createLedgerResponse_kmsKeyArn</a> - The ARN of the customer
--   managed KMS key that the ledger uses for encryption at rest. If this
--   parameter is undefined, the ledger uses an Amazon Web Services owned
--   KMS key for encryption.
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:CreateLedgerResponse'</a>, <a>createLedgerResponse_arn</a>
--   - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the ledger.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:CreateLedger'</a>, <a>createLedgerResponse_name</a> - The
--   name of the ledger.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationDateTime:CreateLedgerResponse'</a>,
--   <a>createLedgerResponse_creationDateTime</a> - The date and time, in
--   epoch time format, when the ledger was created. (Epoch time format is
--   the number of seconds elapsed since 12:00:00 AM January 1, 1970 UTC.)
--   
--   <a>$sel:permissionsMode:CreateLedger'</a>,
--   <a>createLedgerResponse_permissionsMode</a> - The permissions mode of
--   the ledger that you created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:CreateLedgerResponse'</a>,
--   <a>createLedgerResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
newCreateLedgerResponse :: Int -> CreateLedgerResponse

-- | The current status of the ledger.
createLedgerResponse_state :: Lens' CreateLedgerResponse (Maybe LedgerState)

-- | The flag that prevents a ledger from being deleted by any user. If not
--   provided on ledger creation, this feature is enabled (<tt>true</tt>)
--   by default.
--   
--   If deletion protection is enabled, you must first disable it before
--   you can delete the ledger. You can disable it by calling the
--   <tt>UpdateLedger</tt> operation to set the flag to <tt>false</tt>.
createLedgerResponse_deletionProtection :: Lens' CreateLedgerResponse (Maybe Bool)

-- | The ARN of the customer managed KMS key that the ledger uses for
--   encryption at rest. If this parameter is undefined, the ledger uses an
--   Amazon Web Services owned KMS key for encryption.
createLedgerResponse_kmsKeyArn :: Lens' CreateLedgerResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the ledger.
createLedgerResponse_arn :: Lens' CreateLedgerResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the ledger.
createLedgerResponse_name :: Lens' CreateLedgerResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The date and time, in epoch time format, when the ledger was created.
--   (Epoch time format is the number of seconds elapsed since 12:00:00 AM
--   January 1, 1970 UTC.)
createLedgerResponse_creationDateTime :: Lens' CreateLedgerResponse (Maybe UTCTime)

createLedgerResponse_permissionsMode :: Lens' CreateLedgerResponse (Maybe PermissionsMode)

createLedgerResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' CreateLedgerResponse Int

-- | Ends a given Amazon QLDB journal stream. Before a stream can be
--   canceled, its current status must be <tt>ACTIVE</tt>.
--   
--   You can't restart a stream after you cancel it. Canceled QLDB stream
--   resources are subject to a 7-day retention period, so they are
--   automatically deleted after this limit expires.
module Network.AWS.QLDB.CancelJournalKinesisStream

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCancelJournalKinesisStream</a> smart constructor.
data CancelJournalKinesisStream
CancelJournalKinesisStream' :: Text -> Text -> CancelJournalKinesisStream

-- | The name of the ledger.
[$sel:ledgerName:CancelJournalKinesisStream'] :: CancelJournalKinesisStream -> Text

-- | The UUID (represented in Base62-encoded text) of the QLDB journal
--   stream to be canceled.
[$sel:streamId:CancelJournalKinesisStream'] :: CancelJournalKinesisStream -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CancelJournalKinesisStream</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:ledgerName:CancelJournalKinesisStream'</a>,
--   <a>cancelJournalKinesisStream_ledgerName</a> - The name of the ledger.
--   
--   <a>$sel:streamId:CancelJournalKinesisStream'</a>,
--   <a>cancelJournalKinesisStream_streamId</a> - The UUID (represented in
--   Base62-encoded text) of the QLDB journal stream to be canceled.
newCancelJournalKinesisStream :: Text -> Text -> CancelJournalKinesisStream

-- | The name of the ledger.
cancelJournalKinesisStream_ledgerName :: Lens' CancelJournalKinesisStream Text

-- | The UUID (represented in Base62-encoded text) of the QLDB journal
--   stream to be canceled.
cancelJournalKinesisStream_streamId :: Lens' CancelJournalKinesisStream Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCancelJournalKinesisStreamResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.
data CancelJournalKinesisStreamResponse
CancelJournalKinesisStreamResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Int -> CancelJournalKinesisStreamResponse

-- | The UUID (Base62-encoded text) of the canceled QLDB journal stream.
[$sel:streamId:CancelJournalKinesisStreamResponse'] :: CancelJournalKinesisStreamResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:CancelJournalKinesisStreamResponse'] :: CancelJournalKinesisStreamResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>CancelJournalKinesisStreamResponse</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   (Base62-encoded text) of the canceled QLDB journal stream.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:CancelJournalKinesisStreamResponse'</a>,

--   http status code.
newCancelJournalKinesisStreamResponse :: Int -> CancelJournalKinesisStreamResponse

cancelJournalKinesisStreamResponse_streamId :: Lens' CancelJournalKinesisStreamResponse (Maybe Text)

cancelJournalKinesisStreamResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' CancelJournalKinesisStreamResponse Int

-- | Removes one or more tags from a specified Amazon QLDB resource. You
--   can specify up to 50 tag keys to remove.
module Network.AWS.QLDB.UntagResource

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUntagResource</a> smart constructor.
data UntagResource
UntagResource' :: Text -> [Text] -> UntagResource

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) from which to remove the tags. For
--   example:
--   
--   <pre>
--   arn:aws:qldb:us-east-1:123456789012:ledger/exampleLedger
--   </pre>
[$sel:resourceArn:UntagResource'] :: UntagResource -> Text

-- | The list of tag keys to remove.
[$sel:tagKeys:UntagResource'] :: UntagResource -> [Text]

-- | Create a value of <a>UntagResource</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceArn:UntagResource'</a>,
--   <a>untagResource_resourceArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) from
--   which to remove the tags. For example:
--   
--   <pre>
--   arn:aws:qldb:us-east-1:123456789012:ledger/exampleLedger
--   </pre>
--   
--   <a>$sel:tagKeys:UntagResource'</a>, <a>untagResource_tagKeys</a> - The
--   list of tag keys to remove.
newUntagResource :: Text -> UntagResource

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) from which to remove the tags. For
--   example:
--   
--   <pre>
--   arn:aws:qldb:us-east-1:123456789012:ledger/exampleLedger
--   </pre>
untagResource_resourceArn :: Lens' UntagResource Text

-- | The list of tag keys to remove.
untagResource_tagKeys :: Lens' UntagResource [Text]

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUntagResourceResponse</a> smart constructor.
data UntagResourceResponse
UntagResourceResponse' :: Int -> UntagResourceResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:UntagResourceResponse'] :: UntagResourceResponse -> Int

--   fields omitted.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   <a>untagResourceResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
newUntagResourceResponse :: Int -> UntagResourceResponse

untagResourceResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' UntagResourceResponse Int

-- | Updates properties on a ledger.
module Network.AWS.QLDB.UpdateLedger

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateLedger</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateLedger
UpdateLedger' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Text -> UpdateLedger

-- | The flag that prevents a ledger from being deleted by any user. If not
--   provided on ledger creation, this feature is enabled (<tt>true</tt>)
--   by default.
--   
--   If deletion protection is enabled, you must first disable it before
--   you can delete the ledger. You can disable it by calling the
--   <tt>UpdateLedger</tt> operation to set the flag to <tt>false</tt>.
[$sel:deletionProtection:UpdateLedger'] :: UpdateLedger -> Maybe Bool

-- | The key in Key Management Service (KMS) to use for encryption of data
--   at rest in the ledger. For more information, see <a>Encryption at
--   rest</a> in the <i>Amazon QLDB Developer Guide</i>.
--   
--   Use one of the following options to specify this parameter:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>AWS_OWNED_KMS_KEY</tt>: Use an KMS key that is owned and
--   managed by Amazon Web Services on your behalf.</li>
--   <li><b>Undefined</b>: Make no changes to the KMS key of the
--   ledger.</li>
--   <li><b>A valid symmetric customer managed KMS key</b>: Use the
--   specified KMS key in your account that you create, own, and
--   manage.Amazon QLDB does not support asymmetric keys. For more
--   information, see <a>Using symmetric and asymmetric keys</a> in the
--   <i>Key Management Service Developer Guide</i>.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   To specify a customer managed KMS key, you can use its key ID, Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN), alias name, or alias ARN. When using an alias
--   name, prefix it with <tt>"alias/"</tt>. To specify a key in a
--   different account, you must use the key ARN or alias ARN.
--   
--   For example:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Key ID: <tt>1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab</tt></li>
--   <li>Key ARN:
--   <tt>arn:aws:kms:us-east-2:111122223333:key/1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab</tt></li>
--   <li>Alias name: <tt>alias/ExampleAlias</tt></li>
--   <li>Alias ARN:
--   <tt>arn:aws:kms:us-east-2:111122223333:alias/ExampleAlias</tt></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Key identifiers (KeyId)</a> in the <i>Key
--   Management Service Developer Guide</i>.
[$sel:kmsKey:UpdateLedger'] :: UpdateLedger -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the ledger.
[$sel:name:UpdateLedger'] :: UpdateLedger -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateLedger</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:deletionProtection:UpdateLedger'</a>,
--   <a>updateLedger_deletionProtection</a> - The flag that prevents a
--   ledger from being deleted by any user. If not provided on ledger
--   creation, this feature is enabled (<tt>true</tt>) by default.
--   
--   If deletion protection is enabled, you must first disable it before
--   you can delete the ledger. You can disable it by calling the
--   <tt>UpdateLedger</tt> operation to set the flag to <tt>false</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kmsKey:UpdateLedger'</a>, <a>updateLedger_kmsKey</a> - The key
--   in Key Management Service (KMS) to use for encryption of data at rest
--   in the ledger. For more information, see <a>Encryption at rest</a> in
--   the <i>Amazon QLDB Developer Guide</i>.
--   
--   Use one of the following options to specify this parameter:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>AWS_OWNED_KMS_KEY</tt>: Use an KMS key that is owned and
--   managed by Amazon Web Services on your behalf.</li>
--   <li><b>Undefined</b>: Make no changes to the KMS key of the
--   ledger.</li>
--   <li><b>A valid symmetric customer managed KMS key</b>: Use the
--   specified KMS key in your account that you create, own, and
--   manage.Amazon QLDB does not support asymmetric keys. For more
--   information, see <a>Using symmetric and asymmetric keys</a> in the
--   <i>Key Management Service Developer Guide</i>.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   To specify a customer managed KMS key, you can use its key ID, Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN), alias name, or alias ARN. When using an alias
--   name, prefix it with <tt>"alias/"</tt>. To specify a key in a
--   different account, you must use the key ARN or alias ARN.
--   
--   For example:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Key ID: <tt>1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab</tt></li>
--   <li>Key ARN:
--   <tt>arn:aws:kms:us-east-2:111122223333:key/1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab</tt></li>
--   <li>Alias name: <tt>alias/ExampleAlias</tt></li>
--   <li>Alias ARN:
--   <tt>arn:aws:kms:us-east-2:111122223333:alias/ExampleAlias</tt></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Key identifiers (KeyId)</a> in the <i>Key
--   Management Service Developer Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:UpdateLedger'</a>, <a>updateLedger_name</a> - The name of
--   the ledger.
newUpdateLedger :: Text -> UpdateLedger

-- | The flag that prevents a ledger from being deleted by any user. If not
--   provided on ledger creation, this feature is enabled (<tt>true</tt>)
--   by default.
--   
--   If deletion protection is enabled, you must first disable it before
--   you can delete the ledger. You can disable it by calling the
--   <tt>UpdateLedger</tt> operation to set the flag to <tt>false</tt>.
updateLedger_deletionProtection :: Lens' UpdateLedger (Maybe Bool)

-- | The key in Key Management Service (KMS) to use for encryption of data
--   at rest in the ledger. For more information, see <a>Encryption at
--   rest</a> in the <i>Amazon QLDB Developer Guide</i>.
--   
--   Use one of the following options to specify this parameter:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>AWS_OWNED_KMS_KEY</tt>: Use an KMS key that is owned and
--   managed by Amazon Web Services on your behalf.</li>
--   <li><b>Undefined</b>: Make no changes to the KMS key of the
--   ledger.</li>
--   <li><b>A valid symmetric customer managed KMS key</b>: Use the
--   specified KMS key in your account that you create, own, and
--   manage.Amazon QLDB does not support asymmetric keys. For more
--   information, see <a>Using symmetric and asymmetric keys</a> in the
--   <i>Key Management Service Developer Guide</i>.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   To specify a customer managed KMS key, you can use its key ID, Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN), alias name, or alias ARN. When using an alias
--   name, prefix it with <tt>"alias/"</tt>. To specify a key in a
--   different account, you must use the key ARN or alias ARN.
--   
--   For example:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Key ID: <tt>1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab</tt></li>
--   <li>Key ARN:
--   <tt>arn:aws:kms:us-east-2:111122223333:key/1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab</tt></li>
--   <li>Alias name: <tt>alias/ExampleAlias</tt></li>
--   <li>Alias ARN:
--   <tt>arn:aws:kms:us-east-2:111122223333:alias/ExampleAlias</tt></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Key identifiers (KeyId)</a> in the <i>Key
--   Management Service Developer Guide</i>.
updateLedger_kmsKey :: Lens' UpdateLedger (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the ledger.
updateLedger_name :: Lens' UpdateLedger Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateLedgerResponse</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateLedgerResponse
UpdateLedgerResponse' :: Maybe LedgerState -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe LedgerEncryptionDescription -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Int -> UpdateLedgerResponse

-- | The current status of the ledger.
[$sel:state:UpdateLedgerResponse'] :: UpdateLedgerResponse -> Maybe LedgerState

-- | The flag that prevents a ledger from being deleted by any user. If not
--   provided on ledger creation, this feature is enabled (<tt>true</tt>)
--   by default.
--   
--   If deletion protection is enabled, you must first disable it before
--   you can delete the ledger. You can disable it by calling the
--   <tt>UpdateLedger</tt> operation to set the flag to <tt>false</tt>.
[$sel:deletionProtection:UpdateLedgerResponse'] :: UpdateLedgerResponse -> Maybe Bool

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the ledger.
[$sel:arn:UpdateLedgerResponse'] :: UpdateLedgerResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | Information about the encryption of data at rest in the ledger. This
--   includes the current status, the KMS key, and when the key became
--   inaccessible (in the case of an error).
[$sel:encryptionDescription:UpdateLedgerResponse'] :: UpdateLedgerResponse -> Maybe LedgerEncryptionDescription

-- | The name of the ledger.
[$sel:name:UpdateLedgerResponse'] :: UpdateLedgerResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The date and time, in epoch time format, when the ledger was created.
--   (Epoch time format is the number of seconds elapsed since 12:00:00 AM
--   January 1, 1970 UTC.)
[$sel:creationDateTime:UpdateLedgerResponse'] :: UpdateLedgerResponse -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:UpdateLedgerResponse'] :: UpdateLedgerResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateLedgerResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:state:UpdateLedgerResponse'</a>,
--   <a>updateLedgerResponse_state</a> - The current status of the ledger.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deletionProtection:UpdateLedger'</a>,
--   <a>updateLedgerResponse_deletionProtection</a> - The flag that
--   prevents a ledger from being deleted by any user. If not provided on
--   ledger creation, this feature is enabled (<tt>true</tt>) by default.
--   
--   If deletion protection is enabled, you must first disable it before
--   you can delete the ledger. You can disable it by calling the
--   <tt>UpdateLedger</tt> operation to set the flag to <tt>false</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:UpdateLedgerResponse'</a>, <a>updateLedgerResponse_arn</a>
--   - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the ledger.
--   
--   <a>$sel:encryptionDescription:UpdateLedgerResponse'</a>,
--   <a>updateLedgerResponse_encryptionDescription</a> - Information about
--   the encryption of data at rest in the ledger. This includes the
--   current status, the KMS key, and when the key became inaccessible (in
--   the case of an error).
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:UpdateLedger'</a>, <a>updateLedgerResponse_name</a> - The
--   name of the ledger.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationDateTime:UpdateLedgerResponse'</a>,
--   <a>updateLedgerResponse_creationDateTime</a> - The date and time, in
--   epoch time format, when the ledger was created. (Epoch time format is
--   the number of seconds elapsed since 12:00:00 AM January 1, 1970 UTC.)
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:UpdateLedgerResponse'</a>,
--   <a>updateLedgerResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
newUpdateLedgerResponse :: Int -> UpdateLedgerResponse

-- | The current status of the ledger.
updateLedgerResponse_state :: Lens' UpdateLedgerResponse (Maybe LedgerState)

-- | The flag that prevents a ledger from being deleted by any user. If not
--   provided on ledger creation, this feature is enabled (<tt>true</tt>)
--   by default.
--   
--   If deletion protection is enabled, you must first disable it before
--   you can delete the ledger. You can disable it by calling the
--   <tt>UpdateLedger</tt> operation to set the flag to <tt>false</tt>.
updateLedgerResponse_deletionProtection :: Lens' UpdateLedgerResponse (Maybe Bool)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the ledger.
updateLedgerResponse_arn :: Lens' UpdateLedgerResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | Information about the encryption of data at rest in the ledger. This
--   includes the current status, the KMS key, and when the key became
--   inaccessible (in the case of an error).
updateLedgerResponse_encryptionDescription :: Lens' UpdateLedgerResponse (Maybe LedgerEncryptionDescription)

-- | The name of the ledger.
updateLedgerResponse_name :: Lens' UpdateLedgerResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The date and time, in epoch time format, when the ledger was created.
--   (Epoch time format is the number of seconds elapsed since 12:00:00 AM
--   January 1, 1970 UTC.)
updateLedgerResponse_creationDateTime :: Lens' UpdateLedgerResponse (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The response's http status code.
updateLedgerResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' UpdateLedgerResponse Int
