-- | Updates the permissions mode of a ledger.
--   
--   Before you switch to the <tt>STANDARD</tt> permissions mode, you must
--   first create all required IAM policies and table tags to avoid
--   disruption to your users. To learn more, see <a>Migrating to the
--   standard permissions mode</a> in the <i>Amazon QLDB Developer
--   Guide</i>.
module Network.AWS.QLDB.UpdateLedgerPermissionsMode

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateLedgerPermissionsMode</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateLedgerPermissionsMode
UpdateLedgerPermissionsMode' :: Text -> PermissionsMode -> UpdateLedgerPermissionsMode

-- | The name of the ledger.
[$sel:name:UpdateLedgerPermissionsMode'] :: UpdateLedgerPermissionsMode -> Text

-- | The permissions mode to assign to the ledger. This parameter can have
--   one of the following values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>ALLOW_ALL</tt>: A legacy permissions mode that enables access
--   control with API-level granularity for ledgers.This mode allows users
--   who have the <tt>SendCommand</tt> API permission for this ledger to
--   run all PartiQL commands (hence, <tt>ALLOW_ALL</tt>) on any tables in
--   the specified ledger. This mode disregards any table-level or
--   command-level IAM permissions policies that you create for the
--   ledger.</li>
--   <li><tt>STANDARD</tt>: (<i>Recommended</i>) A permissions mode that
--   enables access control with finer granularity for ledgers, tables, and
--   PartiQL commands.By default, this mode denies all user requests to run
--   any PartiQL commands on any tables in this ledger. To allow PartiQL
--   commands to run, you must create IAM permissions policies for specific
--   table resources and PartiQL actions, in addition to the
--   <tt>SendCommand</tt> API permission for the ledger. For information,
--   see <a>Getting started with the standard permissions mode</a> in the
--   <i>Amazon QLDB Developer Guide</i>.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   We strongly recommend using the <tt>STANDARD</tt> permissions mode to
--   maximize the security of your ledger data.
[$sel:permissionsMode:UpdateLedgerPermissionsMode'] :: UpdateLedgerPermissionsMode -> PermissionsMode

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateLedgerPermissionsMode</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:UpdateLedgerPermissionsMode'</a>,
--   <a>updateLedgerPermissionsMode_name</a> - The name of the ledger.
--   
--   <a>$sel:permissionsMode:UpdateLedgerPermissionsMode'</a>,
--   <a>updateLedgerPermissionsMode_permissionsMode</a> - The permissions
--   mode to assign to the ledger. This parameter can have one of the
--   following values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>ALLOW_ALL</tt>: A legacy permissions mode that enables access
--   control with API-level granularity for ledgers.This mode allows users
--   who have the <tt>SendCommand</tt> API permission for this ledger to
--   run all PartiQL commands (hence, <tt>ALLOW_ALL</tt>) on any tables in
--   the specified ledger. This mode disregards any table-level or
--   command-level IAM permissions policies that you create for the
--   ledger.</li>
--   <li><tt>STANDARD</tt>: (<i>Recommended</i>) A permissions mode that
--   enables access control with finer granularity for ledgers, tables, and
--   PartiQL commands.By default, this mode denies all user requests to run
--   any PartiQL commands on any tables in this ledger. To allow PartiQL
--   commands to run, you must create IAM permissions policies for specific
--   table resources and PartiQL actions, in addition to the
--   <tt>SendCommand</tt> API permission for the ledger. For information,
--   see <a>Getting started with the standard permissions mode</a> in the
--   <i>Amazon QLDB Developer Guide</i>.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   We strongly recommend using the <tt>STANDARD</tt> permissions mode to
--   maximize the security of your ledger data.
newUpdateLedgerPermissionsMode :: Text -> PermissionsMode -> UpdateLedgerPermissionsMode

-- | The name of the ledger.
updateLedgerPermissionsMode_name :: Lens' UpdateLedgerPermissionsMode Text

-- | The permissions mode to assign to the ledger. This parameter can have
--   one of the following values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>ALLOW_ALL</tt>: A legacy permissions mode that enables access
--   control with API-level granularity for ledgers.This mode allows users
--   who have the <tt>SendCommand</tt> API permission for this ledger to
--   run all PartiQL commands (hence, <tt>ALLOW_ALL</tt>) on any tables in
--   the specified ledger. This mode disregards any table-level or
--   command-level IAM permissions policies that you create for the
--   ledger.</li>
--   <li><tt>STANDARD</tt>: (<i>Recommended</i>) A permissions mode that
--   enables access control with finer granularity for ledgers, tables, and
--   PartiQL commands.By default, this mode denies all user requests to run
--   any PartiQL commands on any tables in this ledger. To allow PartiQL
--   commands to run, you must create IAM permissions policies for specific
--   table resources and PartiQL actions, in addition to the
--   <tt>SendCommand</tt> API permission for the ledger. For information,
--   see <a>Getting started with the standard permissions mode</a> in the
--   <i>Amazon QLDB Developer Guide</i>.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   We strongly recommend using the <tt>STANDARD</tt> permissions mode to
--   maximize the security of your ledger data.
updateLedgerPermissionsMode_permissionsMode :: Lens' UpdateLedgerPermissionsMode PermissionsMode

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateLedgerPermissionsModeResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.
data UpdateLedgerPermissionsModeResponse
UpdateLedgerPermissionsModeResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe PermissionsMode -> Int -> UpdateLedgerPermissionsModeResponse

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the ledger.
[$sel:arn:UpdateLedgerPermissionsModeResponse'] :: UpdateLedgerPermissionsModeResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the ledger.

[$sel:permissionsMode:UpdateLedgerPermissionsModeResponse'] :: UpdateLedgerPermissionsModeResponse -> Maybe PermissionsMode

[$sel:httpStatus:UpdateLedgerPermissionsModeResponse'] :: UpdateLedgerPermissionsModeResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateLedgerPermissionsModeResponse</a> with all

--

--   http status code.

module Network.AWS.QLDB.Lens

-- | The flag that prevents a ledger from being deleted by any user. If not
--   provided on ledger creation, this feature is enabled (<tt>true</tt>)
--   by default.
--   
--   If deletion protection is enabled, you must first disable it before
--   you can delete the ledger. You can disable it by calling the
--   <tt>UpdateLedger</tt> operation to set the flag to <tt>false</tt>.
updateLedger_deletionProtection :: Lens' UpdateLedger (Maybe Bool)

-- | The key in Key Management Service (KMS) to use for encryption of data
--   at rest in the ledger. For more information, see <a>Encryption at
--   rest</a> in the <i>Amazon QLDB Developer Guide</i>.
--   
--   Use one of the following options to specify this parameter:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>AWS_OWNED_KMS_KEY</tt>: Use an KMS key that is owned and
--   managed by Amazon Web Services on your behalf.</li>
--   <li><b>Undefined</b>: Make no changes to the KMS key of the
--   ledger.</li>
--   <li><b>A valid symmetric customer managed KMS key</b>: Use the
--   specified KMS key in your account that you create, own, and
--   manage.Amazon QLDB does not support asymmetric keys. For more
--   information, see <a>Using symmetric and asymmetric keys</a> in the
--   <i>Key Management Service Developer Guide</i>.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   To specify a customer managed KMS key, you can use its key ID, Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN), alias name, or alias ARN. When using an alias
--   name, prefix it with <tt>"alias/"</tt>. To specify a key in a
--   different account, you must use the key ARN or alias ARN.
--   
--   For example:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Key ID: <tt>1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab</tt></li>
--   <li>Key ARN:
--   <tt>arn:aws:kms:us-east-2:111122223333:key/1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab</tt></li>
--   <li>Alias name: <tt>alias/ExampleAlias</tt></li>
--   <li>Alias ARN:
--   <tt>arn:aws:kms:us-east-2:111122223333:alias/ExampleAlias</tt></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Key identifiers (KeyId)</a> in the <i>Key
--   Management Service Developer Guide</i>.
updateLedger_kmsKey :: Lens' UpdateLedger (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the ledger.
updateLedger_name :: Lens' UpdateLedger Text

-- | The current status of the ledger.
updateLedgerResponse_state :: Lens' UpdateLedgerResponse (Maybe LedgerState)

-- | The flag that prevents a ledger from being deleted by any user. If not
--   provided on ledger creation, this feature is enabled (<tt>true</tt>)
--   by default.
--   
--   If deletion protection is enabled, you must first disable it before
--   you can delete the ledger. You can disable it by calling the
--   <tt>UpdateLedger</tt> operation to set the flag to <tt>false</tt>.
updateLedgerResponse_deletionProtection :: Lens' UpdateLedgerResponse (Maybe Bool)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the ledger.
updateLedgerResponse_arn :: Lens' UpdateLedgerResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | Information about the encryption of data at rest in the ledger. This
--   includes the current status, the KMS key, and when the key became
--   inaccessible (in the case of an error).
updateLedgerResponse_encryptionDescription :: Lens' UpdateLedgerResponse (Maybe LedgerEncryptionDescription)

-- | The name of the ledger.
updateLedgerResponse_name :: Lens' UpdateLedgerResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The date and time, in epoch time format, when the ledger was created.
--   (Epoch time format is the number of seconds elapsed since 12:00:00 AM
--   January 1, 1970 UTC.)
updateLedgerResponse_creationDateTime :: Lens' UpdateLedgerResponse (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The response's http status code.
updateLedgerResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' UpdateLedgerResponse Int

-- | The name of the ledger that you want to delete.
deleteLedger_name :: Lens' DeleteLedger Text

-- | A pagination token, indicating that you want to retrieve the next page
--   of results. If you received a value for <tt>NextToken</tt> in the
--   response from a previous <tt>ListJournalKinesisStreamsForLedger</tt>
--   call, you should use that value as input here.
listJournalKinesisStreamsForLedger_nextToken :: Lens' ListJournalKinesisStreamsForLedger (Maybe Text)

-- | The maximum number of results to return in a single
--   <tt>ListJournalKinesisStreamsForLedger</tt> request. (The actual
--   number of results returned might be fewer.)
listJournalKinesisStreamsForLedger_maxResults :: Lens' ListJournalKinesisStreamsForLedger (Maybe Natural)

-- | The name of the ledger.
listJournalKinesisStreamsForLedger_ledgerName :: Lens' ListJournalKinesisStreamsForLedger Text

-- | <ul>
--   <li>If <tt>NextToken</tt> is empty, the last page of results has been
--   processed and there are no more results to be retrieved.</li>
--   <li>If <tt>NextToken</tt> is <i>not</i> empty, more results are
--   available. To retrieve the next page of results, use the value of
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> in a subsequent
--   <tt>ListJournalKinesisStreamsForLedger</tt> call.</li>
--   </ul>
listJournalKinesisStreamsForLedgerResponse_nextToken :: Lens' ListJournalKinesisStreamsForLedgerResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The array of QLDB journal stream descriptors that are associated with
--   the given ledger.
listJournalKinesisStreamsForLedgerResponse_streams :: Lens' ListJournalKinesisStreamsForLedgerResponse (Maybe [JournalKinesisStreamDescription])

-- | The response's http status code.
listJournalKinesisStreamsForLedgerResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' ListJournalKinesisStreamsForLedgerResponse Int

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for which to list the tags. For
--   example:
--   
--   <pre>
--   arn:aws:qldb:us-east-1:123456789012:ledger/exampleLedger
--   </pre>
listTagsForResource_resourceArn :: Lens' ListTagsForResource Text

-- | The tags that are currently associated with the specified Amazon QLDB
--   resource.
listTagsForResourceResponse_tags :: Lens' ListTagsForResourceResponse (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | The response's http status code.
listTagsForResourceResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' ListTagsForResourceResponse Int

-- | The latest block location covered by the digest for which to request a
--   proof. An address is an Amazon Ion structure that has two fields:
--   <tt>strandId</tt> and <tt>sequenceNo</tt>.
--   
--   For example:
--   <tt>{strandId:"BlFTjlSXze9BIh1KOszcE3",sequenceNo:49}</tt>.
getRevision_digestTipAddress :: Lens' GetRevision (Maybe ValueHolder)

-- | The name of the ledger.
getRevision_name :: Lens' GetRevision Text

-- | The block location of the document revision to be verified. An address
--   is an Amazon Ion structure that has two fields: <tt>strandId</tt> and
--   <tt>sequenceNo</tt>.
--   
--   For example:
--   <tt>{strandId:"BlFTjlSXze9BIh1KOszcE3",sequenceNo:14}</tt>.
getRevision_blockAddress :: Lens' GetRevision ValueHolder

-- | The UUID (represented in Base62-encoded text) of the document to be
--   verified.
getRevision_documentId :: Lens' GetRevision Text

-- | The proof object in Amazon Ion format returned by a
--   <tt>GetRevision</tt> request. A proof contains the list of hash values
--   that are required to recalculate the specified digest using a Merkle
--   tree, starting with the specified document revision.
getRevisionResponse_proof :: Lens' GetRevisionResponse (Maybe ValueHolder)

-- | The response's http status code.
getRevisionResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' GetRevisionResponse Int

-- | The document revision data object in Amazon Ion format.
getRevisionResponse_revision :: Lens' GetRevisionResponse ValueHolder

-- | The name of the ledger that you want to describe.
describeLedger_name :: Lens' DescribeLedger Text

-- | The current status of the ledger.
describeLedgerResponse_state :: Lens' DescribeLedgerResponse (Maybe LedgerState)

-- | The flag that prevents a ledger from being deleted by any user. If not
--   provided on ledger creation, this feature is enabled (<tt>true</tt>)
--   by default.
--   
--   If deletion protection is enabled, you must first disable it before
--   you can delete the ledger. You can disable it by calling the
--   <tt>UpdateLedger</tt> operation to set the flag to <tt>false</tt>.
describeLedgerResponse_deletionProtection :: Lens' DescribeLedgerResponse (Maybe Bool)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the ledger.
describeLedgerResponse_arn :: Lens' DescribeLedgerResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | Information about the encryption of data at rest in the ledger. This
--   includes the current status, the KMS key, and when the key became
--   inaccessible (in the case of an error).
describeLedgerResponse_encryptionDescription :: Lens' DescribeLedgerResponse (Maybe LedgerEncryptionDescription)

-- | The name of the ledger.
describeLedgerResponse_name :: Lens' DescribeLedgerResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The date and time, in epoch time format, when the ledger was created.
--   (Epoch time format is the number of seconds elapsed since 12:00:00 AM
--   January 1, 1970 UTC.)
describeLedgerResponse_creationDateTime :: Lens' DescribeLedgerResponse (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The permissions mode of the ledger.
describeLedgerResponse_permissionsMode :: Lens' DescribeLedgerResponse (Maybe PermissionsMode)

-- | The response's http status code.
describeLedgerResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' DescribeLedgerResponse Int

-- | The name of the ledger.
cancelJournalKinesisStream_ledgerName :: Lens' CancelJournalKinesisStream Text

-- | The UUID (represented in Base62-encoded text) of the QLDB journal
--   stream to be canceled.
cancelJournalKinesisStream_streamId :: Lens' CancelJournalKinesisStream Text

-- | The UUID (Base62-encoded text) of the canceled QLDB journal stream.
cancelJournalKinesisStreamResponse_streamId :: Lens' CancelJournalKinesisStreamResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The response's http status code.
cancelJournalKinesisStreamResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' CancelJournalKinesisStreamResponse Int

-- | The name of the ledger.
exportJournalToS3_name :: Lens' ExportJournalToS3 Text

-- | The inclusive start date and time for the range of journal contents to
--   export.
--   
--   The <tt>InclusiveStartTime</tt> must be in <tt>ISO 8601</tt> date and
--   time format and in Universal Coordinated Time (UTC). For example:
--   <tt>2019-06-13T21:36:34Z</tt>.
--   
--   The <tt>InclusiveStartTime</tt> must be before
--   <tt>ExclusiveEndTime</tt>.
--   
--   If you provide an <tt>InclusiveStartTime</tt> that is before the
--   ledger's <tt>CreationDateTime</tt>, Amazon QLDB defaults it to the
--   ledger's <tt>CreationDateTime</tt>.
exportJournalToS3_inclusiveStartTime :: Lens' ExportJournalToS3 UTCTime

-- | The exclusive end date and time for the range of journal contents to
--   export.
--   
--   The <tt>ExclusiveEndTime</tt> must be in <tt>ISO 8601</tt> date and
--   time format and in Universal Coordinated Time (UTC). For example:
--   <tt>2019-06-13T21:36:34Z</tt>.
--   
--   The <tt>ExclusiveEndTime</tt> must be less than or equal to the
--   current UTC date and time.
exportJournalToS3_exclusiveEndTime :: Lens' ExportJournalToS3 UTCTime

-- | The configuration settings of the Amazon S3 bucket destination for
--   your export request.
exportJournalToS3_s3ExportConfiguration :: Lens' ExportJournalToS3 S3ExportConfiguration

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that grants QLDB
--   permissions for a journal export job to do the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Write objects into your Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3)
--   bucket.</li>
--   <li>(Optional) Use your customer master key (CMK) in Key Management
--   Service (KMS) for server-side encryption of your exported data.</li>
--   </ul>
exportJournalToS3_roleArn :: Lens' ExportJournalToS3 Text

-- | The response's http status code.
exportJournalToS3Response_httpStatus :: Lens' ExportJournalToS3Response Int

-- | The UUID (represented in Base62-encoded text) that QLDB assigns to
--   each journal export job.
--   
--   To describe your export request and check the status of the job, you
--   can use <tt>ExportId</tt> to call <tt>DescribeJournalS3Export</tt>.
exportJournalToS3Response_exportId :: Lens' ExportJournalToS3Response Text

-- | The exclusive date and time that specifies when the stream ends. If
--   you don't define this parameter, the stream runs indefinitely until
--   you cancel it.
--   
--   The <tt>ExclusiveEndTime</tt> must be in <tt>ISO 8601</tt> date and
--   time format and in Universal Coordinated Time (UTC). For example:
--   <tt>2019-06-13T21:36:34Z</tt>.
streamJournalToKinesis_exclusiveEndTime :: Lens' StreamJournalToKinesis (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The key-value pairs to add as tags to the stream that you want to
--   create. Tag keys are case sensitive. Tag values are case sensitive and
--   can be null.
streamJournalToKinesis_tags :: Lens' StreamJournalToKinesis (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | The name of the ledger.
streamJournalToKinesis_ledgerName :: Lens' StreamJournalToKinesis Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that grants QLDB
--   permissions for a journal stream to write data records to a Kinesis
--   Data Streams resource.
streamJournalToKinesis_roleArn :: Lens' StreamJournalToKinesis Text

-- | The inclusive start date and time from which to start streaming
--   journal data. This parameter must be in <tt>ISO 8601</tt> date and
--   time format and in Universal Coordinated Time (UTC). For example:
--   <tt>2019-06-13T21:36:34Z</tt>.
--   
--   The <tt>InclusiveStartTime</tt> cannot be in the future and must be
--   before <tt>ExclusiveEndTime</tt>.
--   
--   If you provide an <tt>InclusiveStartTime</tt> that is before the
--   ledger's <tt>CreationDateTime</tt>, QLDB effectively defaults it to
--   the ledger's <tt>CreationDateTime</tt>.
streamJournalToKinesis_inclusiveStartTime :: Lens' StreamJournalToKinesis UTCTime

-- | The configuration settings of the Kinesis Data Streams destination for
--   your stream request.
streamJournalToKinesis_kinesisConfiguration :: Lens' StreamJournalToKinesis KinesisConfiguration

-- | The name that you want to assign to the QLDB journal stream.
--   User-defined names can help identify and indicate the purpose of a
--   stream.
--   
--   Your stream name must be unique among other <i>active</i> streams for
--   a given ledger. Stream names have the same naming constraints as
--   ledger names, as defined in <a>Quotas in Amazon QLDB</a> in the
--   <i>Amazon QLDB Developer Guide</i>.
streamJournalToKinesis_streamName :: Lens' StreamJournalToKinesis Text

-- | The UUID (represented in Base62-encoded text) that QLDB assigns to
--   each QLDB journal stream.
streamJournalToKinesisResponse_streamId :: Lens' StreamJournalToKinesisResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The response's http status code.
streamJournalToKinesisResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' StreamJournalToKinesisResponse Int

-- | The flag that prevents a ledger from being deleted by any user. If not
--   provided on ledger creation, this feature is enabled (<tt>true</tt>)
--   by default.
--   
--   If deletion protection is enabled, you must first disable it before
--   you can delete the ledger. You can disable it by calling the
--   <tt>UpdateLedger</tt> operation to set the flag to <tt>false</tt>.
createLedger_deletionProtection :: Lens' CreateLedger (Maybe Bool)

-- | The key in Key Management Service (KMS) to use for encryption of data
--   at rest in the ledger. For more information, see <a>Encryption at
--   rest</a> in the <i>Amazon QLDB Developer Guide</i>.
--   
--   Use one of the following options to specify this parameter:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>AWS_OWNED_KMS_KEY</tt>: Use an KMS key that is owned and
--   managed by Amazon Web Services on your behalf.</li>
--   <li><b>Undefined</b>: By default, use an Amazon Web Services owned KMS
--   key.</li>
--   <li><b>A valid symmetric customer managed KMS key</b>: Use the
--   specified KMS key in your account that you create, own, and
--   manage.Amazon QLDB does not support asymmetric keys. For more
--   information, see <a>Using symmetric and asymmetric keys</a> in the
--   <i>Key Management Service Developer Guide</i>.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   To specify a customer managed KMS key, you can use its key ID, Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN), alias name, or alias ARN. When using an alias
--   name, prefix it with <tt>"alias/"</tt>. To specify a key in a
--   different account, you must use the key ARN or alias ARN.
--   
--   For example:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Key ID: <tt>1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab</tt></li>
--   <li>Key ARN:
--   <tt>arn:aws:kms:us-east-2:111122223333:key/1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab</tt></li>
--   <li>Alias name: <tt>alias/ExampleAlias</tt></li>
--   <li>Alias ARN:
--   <tt>arn:aws:kms:us-east-2:111122223333:alias/ExampleAlias</tt></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Key identifiers (KeyId)</a> in the <i>Key
--   Management Service Developer Guide</i>.
createLedger_kmsKey :: Lens' CreateLedger (Maybe Text)

-- | The key-value pairs to add as tags to the ledger that you want to
--   create. Tag keys are case sensitive. Tag values are case sensitive and
--   can be null.
createLedger_tags :: Lens' CreateLedger (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | The name of the ledger that you want to create. The name must be
--   unique among all of the ledgers in your account in the current Region.
--   
--   Naming constraints for ledger names are defined in <a>Quotas in Amazon
--   QLDB</a> in the <i>Amazon QLDB Developer Guide</i>.
createLedger_name :: Lens' CreateLedger Text

-- | The permissions mode to assign to the ledger that you want to create.
--   This parameter can have one of the following values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>ALLOW_ALL</tt>: A legacy permissions mode that enables access
--   control with API-level granularity for ledgers.This mode allows users
--   who have the <tt>SendCommand</tt> API permission for this ledger to
--   run all PartiQL commands (hence, <tt>ALLOW_ALL</tt>) on any tables in
--   the specified ledger. This mode disregards any table-level or
--   command-level IAM permissions policies that you create for the
--   ledger.</li>
--   <li><tt>STANDARD</tt>: (<i>Recommended</i>) A permissions mode that
--   enables access control with finer granularity for ledgers, tables, and
--   PartiQL commands.By default, this mode denies all user requests to run
--   any PartiQL commands on any tables in this ledger. To allow PartiQL
--   commands to run, you must create IAM permissions policies for specific
--   table resources and PartiQL actions, in addition to the
--   <tt>SendCommand</tt> API permission for the ledger. For information,
--   see <a>Getting started with the standard permissions mode</a> in the
--   <i>Amazon QLDB Developer Guide</i>.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   We strongly recommend using the <tt>STANDARD</tt> permissions mode to
--   maximize the security of your ledger data.
createLedger_permissionsMode :: Lens' CreateLedger PermissionsMode

-- | The current status of the ledger.
createLedgerResponse_state :: Lens' CreateLedgerResponse (Maybe LedgerState)

-- | The flag that prevents a ledger from being deleted by any user. If not
--   provided on ledger creation, this feature is enabled (<tt>true</tt>)
--   by default.
--   
--   If deletion protection is enabled, you must first disable it before
--   you can delete the ledger. You can disable it by calling the
--   <tt>UpdateLedger</tt> operation to set the flag to <tt>false</tt>.
createLedgerResponse_deletionProtection :: Lens' CreateLedgerResponse (Maybe Bool)

-- | The ARN of the customer managed KMS key that the ledger uses for
--   encryption at rest. If this parameter is undefined, the ledger uses an
--   Amazon Web Services owned KMS key for encryption.
createLedgerResponse_kmsKeyArn :: Lens' CreateLedgerResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the ledger.
createLedgerResponse_arn :: Lens' CreateLedgerResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the ledger.
createLedgerResponse_name :: Lens' CreateLedgerResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The date and time, in epoch time format, when the ledger was created.
--   (Epoch time format is the number of seconds elapsed since 12:00:00 AM
--   January 1, 1970 UTC.)
createLedgerResponse_creationDateTime :: Lens' CreateLedgerResponse (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The permissions mode of the ledger that you created.
createLedgerResponse_permissionsMode :: Lens' CreateLedgerResponse (Maybe PermissionsMode)

-- | The response's http status code.
createLedgerResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' CreateLedgerResponse Int

-- | A pagination token, indicating that you want to retrieve the next page
--   of results. If you received a value for <tt>NextToken</tt> in the
--   response from a previous <tt>ListLedgers</tt> call, then you should
--   use that value as input here.
listLedgers_nextToken :: Lens' ListLedgers (Maybe Text)

-- | The maximum number of results to return in a single
--   <tt>ListLedgers</tt> request. (The actual number of results returned
--   might be fewer.)
listLedgers_maxResults :: Lens' ListLedgers (Maybe Natural)

-- | The array of ledger summaries that are associated with the current
--   account and Region.
listLedgersResponse_ledgers :: Lens' ListLedgersResponse (Maybe [LedgerSummary])

-- | A pagination token, indicating whether there are more results
--   available:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>If <tt>NextToken</tt> is empty, then the last page of results has
--   been processed and there are no more results to be retrieved.</li>
--   <li>If <tt>NextToken</tt> is <i>not</i> empty, then there are more
--   results available. To retrieve the next page of results, use the value
--   of <tt>NextToken</tt> in a subsequent <tt>ListLedgers</tt> call.</li>
--   </ul>
listLedgersResponse_nextToken :: Lens' ListLedgersResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The response's http status code.
listLedgersResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' ListLedgersResponse Int

-- | A pagination token, indicating that you want to retrieve the next page
--   of results. If you received a value for <tt>NextToken</tt> in the

--   <tt>ListJournalS3Exports</tt> request. (The actual number of results

-- | <ul>
--   <li>If <tt>NextToken</tt> is empty, then the last page of results has
--   been processed and there are no more results to be retrieved.</li>
--   <li>If <tt>NextToken</tt> is <i>not</i> empty, then there are more
--   results available. To retrieve the next page of results, use the value
--   of <tt>NextToken</tt> in a subsequent <tt>ListJournalS3Exports</tt>
--   call.</li>
--   </ul>
listJournalS3ExportsResponse_nextToken :: Lens' ListJournalS3ExportsResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The response's http status code.
listJournalS3ExportsResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' ListJournalS3ExportsResponse Int

-- | The name of the ledger.
updateLedgerPermissionsMode_name :: Lens' UpdateLedgerPermissionsMode Text

-- | The permissions mode to assign to the ledger. This parameter can have
--   one of the following values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>ALLOW_ALL</tt>: A legacy permissions mode that enables access
--   control with API-level granularity for ledgers.This mode allows users
--   who have the <tt>SendCommand</tt> API permission for this ledger to
--   run all PartiQL commands (hence, <tt>ALLOW_ALL</tt>) on any tables in
--   the specified ledger. This mode disregards any table-level or
--   command-level IAM permissions policies that you create for the
--   ledger.</li>
--   <li><tt>STANDARD</tt>: (<i>Recommended</i>) A permissions mode that
--   enables access control with finer granularity for ledgers, tables, and
--   PartiQL commands.By default, this mode denies all user requests to run
--   any PartiQL commands on any tables in this ledger. To allow PartiQL
--   commands to run, you must create IAM permissions policies for specific
--   table resources and PartiQL actions, in addition to the
--   <tt>SendCommand</tt> API permission for the ledger. For information,
--   see <a>Getting started with the standard permissions mode</a> in the
--   <i>Amazon QLDB Developer Guide</i>.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   We strongly recommend using the <tt>STANDARD</tt> permissions mode to
--   maximize the security of your ledger data.
updateLedgerPermissionsMode_permissionsMode :: Lens' UpdateLedgerPermissionsMode PermissionsMode

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the ledger.

-- | The name of the ledger.

-- | The response's http status code.
updateLedgerPermissionsModeResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' UpdateLedgerPermissionsModeResponse Int

-- | The latest block location covered by the digest for which to request a
--   proof. An address is an Amazon Ion structure that has two fields:
--   <tt>strandId</tt> and <tt>sequenceNo</tt>.
--   
--   For example:
--   <tt>{strandId:"BlFTjlSXze9BIh1KOszcE3",sequenceNo:49}</tt>.
getBlock_digestTipAddress :: Lens' GetBlock (Maybe ValueHolder)

-- | The name of the ledger.
getBlock_name :: Lens' GetBlock Text

-- | The location of the block that you want to request. An address is an
--   Amazon Ion structure that has two fields: <tt>strandId</tt> and
--   <tt>sequenceNo</tt>.
--   
--   For example:
--   <tt>{strandId:"BlFTjlSXze9BIh1KOszcE3",sequenceNo:14}</tt>.
getBlock_blockAddress :: Lens' GetBlock ValueHolder

-- | The proof object in Amazon Ion format returned by a <tt>GetBlock</tt>
--   request. A proof contains the list of hash values required to
--   recalculate the specified digest using a Merkle tree, starting with
--   the specified block.
getBlockResponse_proof :: Lens' GetBlockResponse (Maybe ValueHolder)

-- | The response's http status code.
getBlockResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' GetBlockResponse Int

-- | The block data object in Amazon Ion format.
getBlockResponse_block :: Lens' GetBlockResponse ValueHolder

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) to which you want to add the tags. For
--   example:
--   
--   <pre>
--   arn:aws:qldb:us-east-1:123456789012:ledger/exampleLedger
--   </pre>
tagResource_resourceArn :: Lens' TagResource Text

-- | The key-value pairs to add as tags to the specified QLDB resource. Tag
--   keys are case sensitive. If you specify a key that already exists for
--   the resource, your request fails and returns an error. Tag values are
--   case sensitive and can be null.
tagResource_tags :: Lens' TagResource (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The response's http status code.
tagResourceResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' TagResourceResponse Int

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) from which to remove the tags. For
--   example:
--   
--   <pre>
--   arn:aws:qldb:us-east-1:123456789012:ledger/exampleLedger
--   </pre>
untagResource_resourceArn :: Lens' UntagResource Text

-- | The list of tag keys to remove.
untagResource_tagKeys :: Lens' UntagResource [Text]

-- | The response's http status code.
untagResourceResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' UntagResourceResponse Int

-- | The name of the ledger.
getDigest_name :: Lens' GetDigest Text

-- | The response's http status code.
getDigestResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' GetDigestResponse Int

-- | The 256-bit hash value representing the digest returned by a
--   <tt>GetDigest</tt> request.-- -- <i>Note:</i> This <tt>Lens</tt>
--   automatically encodes and decodes Base64 data. -- The underlying
--   isomorphism will encode to Base64 representation during --
--   serialisation, and decode from Base64 representation during
--   deserialisation. -- This <tt>Lens</tt> accepts and returns only raw
--   unencoded data.
getDigestResponse_digest :: Lens' GetDigestResponse ByteString

-- | The latest block location covered by the digest that you requested. An
--   address is an Amazon Ion structure that has two fields:
--   <tt>strandId</tt> and <tt>sequenceNo</tt>.
getDigestResponse_digestTipAddress :: Lens' GetDigestResponse ValueHolder

-- | The date and time, in epoch time format, when the QLDB journal stream
--   was created. (Epoch time format is the number of seconds elapsed since
--   12:00:00 AM January 1, 1970 UTC.)
journalKinesisStreamDescription_creationTime :: Lens' JournalKinesisStreamDescription (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the QLDB journal stream.
journalKinesisStreamDescription_arn :: Lens' JournalKinesisStreamDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | The inclusive start date and time from which to start streaming
--   journal data.
journalKinesisStreamDescription_inclusiveStartTime :: Lens' JournalKinesisStreamDescription (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The error message that describes the reason that a stream has a status
--   of <tt>IMPAIRED</tt> or <tt>FAILED</tt>. This is not applicable to
--   streams that have other status values.
journalKinesisStreamDescription_errorCause :: Lens' JournalKinesisStreamDescription (Maybe ErrorCause)

-- | The exclusive date and time that specifies when the stream ends. If
--   this parameter is undefined, the stream runs indefinitely until you
--   cancel it.
journalKinesisStreamDescription_exclusiveEndTime :: Lens' JournalKinesisStreamDescription (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The name of the ledger.
journalKinesisStreamDescription_ledgerName :: Lens' JournalKinesisStreamDescription Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that grants QLDB
--   permissions for a journal stream to write data records to a Kinesis
--   Data Streams resource.
journalKinesisStreamDescription_roleArn :: Lens' JournalKinesisStreamDescription Text

-- | The UUID (represented in Base62-encoded text) of the QLDB journal
--   stream.
journalKinesisStreamDescription_streamId :: Lens' JournalKinesisStreamDescription Text

-- | The current state of the QLDB journal stream.
journalKinesisStreamDescription_status :: Lens' JournalKinesisStreamDescription StreamStatus

-- | The configuration settings of the Amazon Kinesis Data Streams
--   destination for a QLDB journal stream.
journalKinesisStreamDescription_kinesisConfiguration :: Lens' JournalKinesisStreamDescription KinesisConfiguration

-- | The user-defined name of the QLDB journal stream.
journalKinesisStreamDescription_streamName :: Lens' JournalKinesisStreamDescription Text

-- | The name of the ledger.
journalS3ExportDescription_ledgerName :: Lens' JournalS3ExportDescription Text

-- | The UUID (represented in Base62-encoded text) of the journal export
--   job.
journalS3ExportDescription_exportId :: Lens' JournalS3ExportDescription Text

-- | The date and time, in epoch time format, when the export job was
--   created. (Epoch time format is the number of seconds elapsed since
--   12:00:00 AM January 1, 1970 UTC.)
journalS3ExportDescription_exportCreationTime :: Lens' JournalS3ExportDescription UTCTime

-- | The current state of the journal export job.
journalS3ExportDescription_status :: Lens' JournalS3ExportDescription ExportStatus

-- | The inclusive start date and time for the range of journal contents
--   that are specified in the original export request.
journalS3ExportDescription_inclusiveStartTime :: Lens' JournalS3ExportDescription UTCTime

-- | The exclusive end date and time for the range of journal contents that
--   are specified in the original export request.
journalS3ExportDescription_exclusiveEndTime :: Lens' JournalS3ExportDescription UTCTime

-- | Undocumented member.
journalS3ExportDescription_s3ExportConfiguration :: Lens' JournalS3ExportDescription S3ExportConfiguration

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that grants QLDB
--   permissions for a journal export job to do the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Write objects into your Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3)
--   bucket.</li>
--   <li>(Optional) Use your customer master key (CMK) in Key Management
--   Service (KMS) for server-side encryption of your exported data.</li>
--   </ul>
journalS3ExportDescription_roleArn :: Lens' JournalS3ExportDescription Text

-- | Enables QLDB to publish multiple data records in a single Kinesis Data
--   Streams record, increasing the number of records sent per API call.
--   
--   <i>This option is enabled by default.</i> Record aggregation has
--   important implications for processing records and requires
--   de-aggregation in your stream consumer. To learn more, see <a>KPL Key
--   Concepts</a> and <a>Consumer De-aggregation</a> in the <i>Amazon
--   Kinesis Data Streams Developer Guide</i>.
kinesisConfiguration_aggregationEnabled :: Lens' KinesisConfiguration (Maybe Bool)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Kinesis Data Streams resource.
kinesisConfiguration_streamArn :: Lens' KinesisConfiguration Text

-- | The date and time, in epoch time format, when the KMS key first became
--   inaccessible, in the case of an error. (Epoch time format is the
--   number of seconds that have elapsed since 12:00:00 AM January 1, 1970
--   UTC.)
--   
--   This parameter is undefined if the KMS key is accessible.
ledgerEncryptionDescription_inaccessibleKmsKeyDateTime :: Lens' LedgerEncryptionDescription (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the customer managed KMS key that
--   the ledger uses for encryption at rest. If this parameter is
--   undefined, the ledger uses an Amazon Web Services owned KMS key for
--   encryption.
ledgerEncryptionDescription_kmsKeyArn :: Lens' LedgerEncryptionDescription Text

-- | The current state of encryption at rest for the ledger. This can be
--   one of the following values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>ENABLED</tt>: Encryption is fully enabled using the specified
--   key.</li>
--   <li><tt>UPDATING</tt>: The ledger is actively processing the specified
--   key change.Key changes in QLDB are asynchronous. The ledger is fully
--   accessible without any performance impact while the key change is
--   being processed. The amount of time it takes to update a key varies
--   depending on the ledger size.</li>
--   <li><tt>KMS_KEY_INACCESSIBLE</tt>: The specified customer managed KMS
--   key is not accessible, and the ledger is impaired. Either the key was
--   disabled or deleted, or the grants on the key were revoked. When a
--   ledger is impaired, it is not accessible and does not accept any read
--   or write requests.An impaired ledger automatically returns to an
--   active state after you restore the grants on the key, or re-enable the
--   key that was disabled. However, deleting a customer managed KMS key is
--   irreversible. After a key is deleted, you can no longer access the
--   ledgers that are protected with that key, and the data becomes
--   unrecoverable permanently.</li>
--   </ul>
ledgerEncryptionDescription_encryptionStatus :: Lens' LedgerEncryptionDescription EncryptionStatus

-- | The current status of the ledger.
ledgerSummary_state :: Lens' LedgerSummary (Maybe LedgerState)

-- | The name of the ledger.
ledgerSummary_name :: Lens' LedgerSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The date and time, in epoch time format, when the ledger was created.
--   (Epoch time format is the number of seconds elapsed since 12:00:00 AM
--   January 1, 1970 UTC.)
ledgerSummary_creationDateTime :: Lens' LedgerSummary (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a symmetric customer master key
--   (CMK) in Key Management Service (KMS). Amazon S3 does not support
--   asymmetric CMKs.
--   
--   You must provide a <tt>KmsKeyArn</tt> if you specify <tt>SSE_KMS</tt>
--   as the <tt>ObjectEncryptionType</tt>.
--   
--   <tt>KmsKeyArn</tt> is not required if you specify <tt>SSE_S3</tt> as
--   the <tt>ObjectEncryptionType</tt>.
s3EncryptionConfiguration_kmsKeyArn :: Lens' S3EncryptionConfiguration (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon S3 object encryption type.
--   
--   To learn more about server-side encryption options in Amazon S3, see
--   <a>Protecting Data Using Server-Side Encryption</a> in the <i>Amazon
--   S3 Developer Guide</i>.
s3EncryptionConfiguration_objectEncryptionType :: Lens' S3EncryptionConfiguration S3ObjectEncryptionType

-- | The Amazon S3 bucket name in which a journal export job writes the
--   journal contents.
--   
--   The bucket name must comply with the Amazon S3 bucket naming
--   conventions. For more information, see <a>Bucket Restrictions and
--   Limitations</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 Developer Guide</i>.
s3ExportConfiguration_bucket :: Lens' S3ExportConfiguration Text

-- | The prefix for the Amazon S3 bucket in which a journal export job
--   writes the journal contents.
--   
--   The prefix must comply with Amazon S3 key naming rules and
--   restrictions. For more information, see <a>Object Key and Metadata</a>
--   in the <i>Amazon S3 Developer Guide</i>.
--   
--   The following are examples of valid <tt>Prefix</tt> values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>JournalExports-ForMyLedger/Testing/</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>JournalExports</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>My:Tests/</pre></li>
--   </ul>
s3ExportConfiguration_prefix :: Lens' S3ExportConfiguration Text

-- | The encryption settings that are used by a journal export job to write
--   data in an Amazon S3 bucket.
s3ExportConfiguration_encryptionConfiguration :: Lens' S3ExportConfiguration S3EncryptionConfiguration

-- | An Amazon Ion plaintext value contained in a <tt>ValueHolder</tt>
--   structure.
valueHolder_ionText :: Lens' ValueHolder (Maybe Text)


module Network.AWS.QLDB.Waiters


-- | Derived from API version <tt>2019-01-02</tt> of the AWS service
--   descriptions, licensed under Apache 2.0.
--   
--   The control plane for Amazon QLDB
module Network.AWS.QLDB

-- | API version <tt>2019-01-02</tt> of the Amazon QLDB SDK configuration.
defaultService :: Service

-- | One or more parameters in the request aren't valid.
_InvalidParameterException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The operation failed because a condition wasn't satisfied in advance.
_ResourcePreconditionNotMetException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The specified resource already exists.
_ResourceAlreadyExistsException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The specified resource doesn't exist.
_ResourceNotFoundException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | You have reached the limit on the maximum number of resources allowed.
_LimitExceededException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The specified resource can't be modified at this time.
_ResourceInUseException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateLedger</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateLedger
UpdateLedger' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Text -> UpdateLedger

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateLedger</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:deletionProtection:UpdateLedger'</a>,
--   <a>updateLedger_deletionProtection</a> - The flag that prevents a
--   ledger from being deleted by any user. If not provided on ledger
--   creation, this feature is enabled (<tt>true</tt>) by default.
--   
--   If deletion protection is enabled, you must first disable it before
--   you can delete the ledger. You can disable it by calling the
--   <tt>UpdateLedger</tt> operation to set the flag to <tt>false</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kmsKey:UpdateLedger'</a>, <a>updateLedger_kmsKey</a> - The key
--   in Key Management Service (KMS) to use for encryption of data at rest
--   in the ledger. For more information, see <a>Encryption at rest</a> in
--   the <i>Amazon QLDB Developer Guide</i>.
--   
--   Use one of the following options to specify this parameter:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>AWS_OWNED_KMS_KEY</tt>: Use an KMS key that is owned and
--   managed by Amazon Web Services on your behalf.</li>
--   <li><b>Undefined</b>: Make no changes to the KMS key of the
--   ledger.</li>
--   <li><b>A valid symmetric customer managed KMS key</b>: Use the
--   specified KMS key in your account that you create, own, and
--   manage.Amazon QLDB does not support asymmetric keys. For more
--   information, see <a>Using symmetric and asymmetric keys</a> in the
--   <i>Key Management Service Developer Guide</i>.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   To specify a customer managed KMS key, you can use its key ID, Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN), alias name, or alias ARN. When using an alias
--   name, prefix it with <tt>"alias/"</tt>. To specify a key in a
--   different account, you must use the key ARN or alias ARN.
--   
--   For example:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Key ID: <tt>1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab</tt></li>
--   <li>Key ARN:
--   <tt>arn:aws:kms:us-east-2:111122223333:key/1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab</tt></li>
--   <li>Alias name: <tt>alias/ExampleAlias</tt></li>
--   <li>Alias ARN:
--   <tt>arn:aws:kms:us-east-2:111122223333:alias/ExampleAlias</tt></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Key identifiers (KeyId)</a> in the <i>Key
--   Management Service Developer Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:UpdateLedger'</a>, <a>updateLedger_name</a> - The name of
--   the ledger.
newUpdateLedger :: Text -> UpdateLedger

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newGetRevision</a> smart constructor.
data GetRevision
GetRevision' :: Maybe (Sensitive ValueHolder) -> Text -> Sensitive ValueHolder -> Text -> GetRevision

-- | Create a value of <a>GetRevision</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:digestTipAddress:GetRevision'</a>,
--   <a>getRevision_digestTipAddress</a> - The latest block location
--   covered by the digest for which to request a proof. An address is an
--   Amazon Ion structure that has two fields: <tt>strandId</tt> and
--   <tt>sequenceNo</tt>.
--   
--   For example:
--   <tt>{strandId:"BlFTjlSXze9BIh1KOszcE3",sequenceNo:49}</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:GetRevision'</a>, <a>getRevision_name</a> - The name of
--   the ledger.
--   
--   <a>$sel:blockAddress:GetRevision'</a>, <a>getRevision_blockAddress</a>
--   - The block location of the document revision to be verified. An
--   address is an Amazon Ion structure that has two fields:
--   <tt>strandId</tt> and <tt>sequenceNo</tt>.
--   
--   For example:
--   <tt>{strandId:"BlFTjlSXze9BIh1KOszcE3",sequenceNo:14}</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:documentId:GetRevision'</a>, <a>getRevision_documentId</a> -
--   The UUID (represented in Base62-encoded text) of the document to be
--   verified.
newGetRevision :: Text -> ValueHolder -> Text -> GetRevision

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newGetRevisionResponse</a> smart constructor.
data GetRevisionResponse
GetRevisionResponse' :: Maybe (Sensitive ValueHolder) -> Int -> Sensitive ValueHolder -> GetRevisionResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>GetRevisionResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:proof:GetRevisionResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getRevisionResponse_proof</a> - The proof object in Amazon Ion
--   format returned by a <tt>GetRevision</tt> request. A proof contains
--   the list of hash values that are required to recalculate the specified
--   digest using a Merkle tree, starting with the specified document
--   revision.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:GetRevisionResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getRevisionResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
--   
--   <a>$sel:revision:GetRevisionResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getRevisionResponse_revision</a> - The document revision data
--   object in Amazon Ion format.

data CancelJournalKinesisStream
CancelJournalKinesisStream' :: Text -> Text -> CancelJournalKinesisStream

-- | Create a value of <a>CancelJournalKinesisStream</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   Base62-encoded text) of the QLDB journal stream to be canceled.

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newExportJournalToS3</a> smart constructor.
data ExportJournalToS3
ExportJournalToS3' :: Text -> POSIX -> POSIX -> S3ExportConfiguration -> Text -> ExportJournalToS3

-- | Create a value of <a>ExportJournalToS3</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:ExportJournalToS3'</a>, <a>exportJournalToS3_name</a> -
--   The name of the ledger.
--   
--   <a>$sel:inclusiveStartTime:ExportJournalToS3'</a>,
--   <a>exportJournalToS3_inclusiveStartTime</a> - The inclusive start date
--   and time for the range of journal contents to export.
--   
--   The <tt>InclusiveStartTime</tt> must be in <tt>ISO 8601</tt> date and
--   time format and in Universal Coordinated Time (UTC). For example:
--   <tt>2019-06-13T21:36:34Z</tt>.
--   
--   The <tt>InclusiveStartTime</tt> must be before
--   <tt>ExclusiveEndTime</tt>.
--   
--   If you provide an <tt>InclusiveStartTime</tt> that is before the
--   ledger's <tt>CreationDateTime</tt>, Amazon QLDB defaults it to the
--   ledger's <tt>CreationDateTime</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:exclusiveEndTime:ExportJournalToS3'</a>,
--   <a>exportJournalToS3_exclusiveEndTime</a> - The exclusive end date and
--   time for the range of journal contents to export.
--   
--   The <tt>ExclusiveEndTime</tt> must be in <tt>ISO 8601</tt> date and
--   time format and in Universal Coordinated Time (UTC). For example:
--   <tt>2019-06-13T21:36:34Z</tt>.
--   
--   The <tt>ExclusiveEndTime</tt> must be less than or equal to the
--   current UTC date and time.
--   
--   <a>$sel:s3ExportConfiguration:ExportJournalToS3'</a>,
--   <a>exportJournalToS3_s3ExportConfiguration</a> - The configuration
--   settings of the Amazon S3 bucket destination for your export request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleArn:ExportJournalToS3'</a>,
--   <a>exportJournalToS3_roleArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of
--   the IAM role that grants QLDB permissions for a journal export job to
--   do the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Write objects into your Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3)
--   bucket.</li>
--   <li>(Optional) Use your customer master key (CMK) in Key Management
--   Service (KMS) for server-side encryption of your exported data.</li>
--   </ul>
newExportJournalToS3 :: Text -> UTCTime -> UTCTime -> S3ExportConfiguration -> Text -> ExportJournalToS3

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newExportJournalToS3Response</a> smart constructor.
data ExportJournalToS3Response

data StreamJournalToKinesis
StreamJournalToKinesis' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Text -> Text -> POSIX -> KinesisConfiguration -> Text -> StreamJournalToKinesis

-- | Create a value of <a>StreamJournalToKinesis</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:exclusiveEndTime:StreamJournalToKinesis'</a>,
--   <a>streamJournalToKinesis_exclusiveEndTime</a> - The exclusive date
--   and time that specifies when the stream ends. If you don't define this
--   parameter, the stream runs indefinitely until you cancel it.
--   
--   The <tt>ExclusiveEndTime</tt> must be in <tt>ISO 8601</tt> date and
--   time format and in Universal Coordinated Time (UTC). For example:
--   <tt>2019-06-13T21:36:34Z</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:StreamJournalToKinesis'</a>,
--   <a>streamJournalToKinesis_tags</a> - The key-value pairs to add as
--   tags to the stream that you want to create. Tag keys are case
--   sensitive. Tag values are case sensitive and can be null.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ledgerName:StreamJournalToKinesis'</a>,
--   <a>streamJournalToKinesis_ledgerName</a> - The name of the ledger.
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleArn:StreamJournalToKinesis'</a>,
--   <a>streamJournalToKinesis_roleArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN)
--   of the IAM role that grants QLDB permissions for a journal stream to
--   write data records to a Kinesis Data Streams resource.
--   
--   <a>$sel:inclusiveStartTime:StreamJournalToKinesis'</a>,
--   <a>streamJournalToKinesis_inclusiveStartTime</a> - The inclusive start
--   date and time from which to start streaming journal data. This
--   parameter must be in <tt>ISO 8601</tt> date and time format and in
--   Universal Coordinated Time (UTC). For example:
--   <tt>2019-06-13T21:36:34Z</tt>.
--   
--   The <tt>InclusiveStartTime</tt> cannot be in the future and must be
--   before <tt>ExclusiveEndTime</tt>.
--   
--   If you provide an <tt>InclusiveStartTime</tt> that is before the
--   ledger's <tt>CreationDateTime</tt>, QLDB effectively defaults it to
--   the ledger's <tt>CreationDateTime</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kinesisConfiguration:StreamJournalToKinesis'</a>,
--   <a>streamJournalToKinesis_kinesisConfiguration</a> - The configuration
--   settings of the Kinesis Data Streams destination for your stream
--   request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:streamName:StreamJournalToKinesis'</a>,
--   <a>streamJournalToKinesis_streamName</a> - The name that you want to
--   assign to the QLDB journal stream. User-defined names can help
--   identify and indicate the purpose of a stream.
--   
--   Your stream name must be unique among other <i>active</i> streams for
--   a given ledger. Stream names have the same naming constraints as
--   ledger names, as defined in <a>Quotas in Amazon QLDB</a> in the
--   <i>Amazon QLDB Developer Guide</i>.
newStreamJournalToKinesis :: Text -> Text -> UTCTime -> KinesisConfiguration -> Text -> StreamJournalToKinesis

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateLedger</a> smart constructor.
data CreateLedger
CreateLedger' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Text -> PermissionsMode -> CreateLedger

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateLedger</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:deletionProtection:CreateLedger'</a>,
--   <a>createLedger_deletionProtection</a> - The flag that prevents a
--   ledger from being deleted by any user. If not provided on ledger
--   creation, this feature is enabled (<tt>true</tt>) by default.
--   
--   If deletion protection is enabled, you must first disable it before
--   you can delete the ledger. You can disable it by calling the
--   <tt>UpdateLedger</tt> operation to set the flag to <tt>false</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kmsKey:CreateLedger'</a>, <a>createLedger_kmsKey</a> - The key
--   in Key Management Service (KMS) to use for encryption of data at rest
--   in the ledger. For more information, see <a>Encryption at rest</a> in
--   the <i>Amazon QLDB Developer Guide</i>.
--   
--   Use one of the following options to specify this parameter:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>AWS_OWNED_KMS_KEY</tt>: Use an KMS key that is owned and
--   managed by Amazon Web Services on your behalf.</li>
--   <li><b>Undefined</b>: By default, use an Amazon Web Services owned KMS
--   key.</li>
--   <li><b>A valid symmetric customer managed KMS key</b>: Use the
--   specified KMS key in your account that you create, own, and
--   manage.Amazon QLDB does not support asymmetric keys. For more
--   information, see <a>Using symmetric and asymmetric keys</a> in the
--   <i>Key Management Service Developer Guide</i>.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   To specify a customer managed KMS key, you can use its key ID, Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN), alias name, or alias ARN. When using an alias
--   name, prefix it with <tt>"alias/"</tt>. To specify a key in a
--   different account, you must use the key ARN or alias ARN.
--   
--   For example:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Key ID: <tt>1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab</tt></li>
--   <li>Key ARN:
--   <tt>arn:aws:kms:us-east-2:111122223333:key/1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab</tt></li>
--   <li>Alias name: <tt>alias/ExampleAlias</tt></li>
--   <li>Alias ARN:
--   <tt>arn:aws:kms:us-east-2:111122223333:alias/ExampleAlias</tt></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Key identifiers (KeyId)</a> in the <i>Key
--   Management Service Developer Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:CreateLedger'</a>, <a>createLedger_tags</a> - The
--   key-value pairs to add as tags to the ledger that you want to create.
--   Tag keys are case sensitive. Tag values are case sensitive and can be
--   null.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:CreateLedger'</a>, <a>createLedger_name</a> - The name of
--   the ledger that you want to create. The name must be unique among all
--   of the ledgers in your account in the current Region.
--   
--   Naming constraints for ledger names are defined in <a>Quotas in Amazon
--   QLDB</a> in the <i>Amazon QLDB Developer Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:permissionsMode:CreateLedger'</a>,
--   <a>createLedger_permissionsMode</a> - The permissions mode to assign
--   to the ledger that you want to create. This parameter can have one of
--   the following values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>ALLOW_ALL</tt>: A legacy permissions mode that enables access
--   control with API-level granularity for ledgers.This mode allows users
--   who have the <tt>SendCommand</tt> API permission for this ledger to
--   run all PartiQL commands (hence, <tt>ALLOW_ALL</tt>) on any tables in
--   the specified ledger. This mode disregards any table-level or
--   command-level IAM permissions policies that you create for the
--   ledger.</li>
--   <li><tt>STANDARD</tt>: (<i>Recommended</i>) A permissions mode that
--   enables access control with finer granularity for ledgers, tables, and
--   PartiQL commands.By default, this mode denies all user requests to run
--   any PartiQL commands on any tables in this ledger. To allow PartiQL
--   commands to run, you must create IAM permissions policies for specific
--   table resources and PartiQL actions, in addition to the
--   <tt>SendCommand</tt> API permission for the ledger. For information,
--   see <a>Getting started with the standard permissions mode</a> in the
--   <i>Amazon QLDB Developer Guide</i>.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   We strongly recommend using the <tt>STANDARD</tt> permissions mode to
--   maximize the security of your ledger data.
newCreateLedger :: Text -> PermissionsMode -> CreateLedger

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateLedgerResponse</a> smart constructor.
data CreateLedgerResponse
CreateLedgerResponse' :: Maybe LedgerState -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe PermissionsMode -> Int -> CreateLedgerResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateLedgerResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.

--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:state:CreateLedgerResponse'</a>,
--   <a>createLedgerResponse_state</a> - The current status of the ledger.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deletionProtection:CreateLedger'</a>,
--   <a>createLedgerResponse_deletionProtection</a> - The flag that
--   prevents a ledger from being deleted by any user. If not provided on
--   ledger creation, this feature is enabled (<tt>true</tt>) by default.
--   
--   If deletion protection is enabled, you must first disable it before
--   you can delete the ledger. You can disable it by calling the
--   <tt>UpdateLedger</tt> operation to set the flag to <tt>false</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kmsKeyArn:CreateLedgerResponse'</a>,
--   <a>createLedgerResponse_kmsKeyArn</a> - The ARN of the customer
--   managed KMS key that the ledger uses for encryption at rest. If this
--   parameter is undefined, the ledger uses an Amazon Web Services owned
--   KMS key for encryption.
--

--   - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the ledger.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:CreateLedger'</a>, <a>createLedgerResponse_name</a> - The
--   name of the ledger.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationDateTime:CreateLedgerResponse'</a>,
--   <a>createLedgerResponse_creationDateTime</a> - The date and time, in
--   epoch time format, when the ledger was created. (Epoch time format is
--   the number of seconds elapsed since 12:00:00 AM January 1, 1970 UTC.)
--   
--   <a>$sel:permissionsMode:CreateLedger'</a>,
--   <a>createLedgerResponse_permissionsMode</a> - The permissions mode of
--   the ledger that you created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:CreateLedgerResponse'</a>,
--   <a>createLedgerResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
newCreateLedgerResponse :: Int -> CreateLedgerResponse

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateLedgerPermissionsMode</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateLedgerPermissionsMode
UpdateLedgerPermissionsMode' :: Text -> PermissionsMode -> UpdateLedgerPermissionsMode

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateLedgerPermissionsMode</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:UpdateLedgerPermissionsMode'</a>,
--   <a>updateLedgerPermissionsMode_name</a> - The name of the ledger.
--   
--   <a>$sel:permissionsMode:UpdateLedgerPermissionsMode'</a>,
--   <a>updateLedgerPermissionsMode_permissionsMode</a> - The permissions
--   mode to assign to the ledger. This parameter can have one of the
--   following values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>ALLOW_ALL</tt>: A legacy permissions mode that enables access
--   control with API-level granularity for ledgers.This mode allows users
--   who have the <tt>SendCommand</tt> API permission for this ledger to
--   run all PartiQL commands (hence, <tt>ALLOW_ALL</tt>) on any tables in
--   the specified ledger. This mode disregards any table-level or
--   command-level IAM permissions policies that you create for the
--   ledger.</li>
--   <li><tt>STANDARD</tt>: (<i>Recommended</i>) A permissions mode that
--   enables access control with finer granularity for ledgers, tables, and
--   PartiQL commands.By default, this mode denies all user requests to run
--   any PartiQL commands on any tables in this ledger. To allow PartiQL
--   commands to run, you must create IAM permissions policies for specific
--   table resources and PartiQL actions, in addition to the
--   <tt>SendCommand</tt> API permission for the ledger. For information,
--   see <a>Getting started with the standard permissions mode</a> in the
--   <i>Amazon QLDB Developer Guide</i>.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   We strongly recommend using the <tt>STANDARD</tt> permissions mode to
--   maximize the security of your ledger data.
newUpdateLedgerPermissionsMode :: Text -> PermissionsMode -> UpdateLedgerPermissionsMode

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateLedgerPermissionsModeResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.
data UpdateLedgerPermissionsModeResponse
UpdateLedgerPermissionsModeResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe PermissionsMode -> Int -> UpdateLedgerPermissionsModeResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateLedgerPermissionsModeResponse</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:UpdateLedgerPermissionsModeResponse'</a>,
--   <a>updateLedgerPermissionsModeResponse_arn</a> - The Amazon Resource
--   Name (ARN) for the ledger.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:UpdateLedgerPermissionsMode'</a>,
--   <a>updateLedgerPermissionsModeResponse_name</a> - The name of the
--   ledger.
--   
--   <a>$sel:permissionsMode:UpdateLedgerPermissionsMode'</a>,
--   <a>updateLedgerPermissionsModeResponse_permissionsMode</a> - The
--   current permissions mode of the ledger.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:UpdateLedgerPermissionsModeResponse'</a>,
--   <a>updateLedgerPermissionsModeResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's
--   http status code.
newUpdateLedgerPermissionsModeResponse :: Int -> UpdateLedgerPermissionsModeResponse

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newGetBlock</a> smart constructor.
data GetBlock
GetBlock' :: Maybe (Sensitive ValueHolder) -> Text -> Sensitive ValueHolder -> GetBlock

-- | Create a value of <a>GetBlock</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:digestTipAddress:GetBlock'</a>,
--   <a>getBlock_digestTipAddress</a> - The latest block location covered
--   by the digest for which to request a proof. An address is an Amazon
--   Ion structure that has two fields: <tt>strandId</tt> and
--   <tt>sequenceNo</tt>.
--   
--   For example:
--   <tt>{strandId:"BlFTjlSXze9BIh1KOszcE3",sequenceNo:49}</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:GetBlock'</a>, <a>getBlock_name</a> - The name of the
--   ledger.
--   
--   <a>$sel:blockAddress:GetBlock'</a>, <a>getBlock_blockAddress</a> - The
--   location of the block that you want to request. An address is an
--   Amazon Ion structure that has two fields: <tt>strandId</tt> and
--   <tt>sequenceNo</tt>.
--   
--   For example:
--   <tt>{strandId:"BlFTjlSXze9BIh1KOszcE3",sequenceNo:14}</tt>.
newGetBlock :: Text -> ValueHolder -> GetBlock

-- | Create a value of <a>GetBlockResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   The proof object in Amazon Ion format returned by a <tt>GetBlock</tt>
--   request. A proof contains the list of hash values required to
--   recalculate the specified digest using a Merkle tree, starting with
--   the specified block.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:GetBlockResponse'</a>,

newtype EncryptionStatus
EncryptionStatus' :: Text -> EncryptionStatus

pattern EncryptionStatus_ENABLED :: EncryptionStatus
pattern EncryptionStatus_KMS_KEY_INACCESSIBLE :: EncryptionStatus
pattern EncryptionStatus_UPDATING :: EncryptionStatus

pattern ErrorCause_KINESIS_STREAM_NOT_FOUND :: ErrorCause

pattern ExportStatus_COMPLETED :: ExportStatus
pattern ExportStatus_IN_PROGRESS :: ExportStatus

pattern LedgerState_DELETED :: LedgerState
pattern LedgerState_DELETING :: LedgerState

pattern StreamStatus_CANCELED :: StreamStatus
pattern StreamStatus_COMPLETED :: StreamStatus
pattern StreamStatus_FAILED :: StreamStatus

-- | Information about an Amazon QLDB journal stream, including the Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN), stream name, creation time, current status, and
--   the parameters of the original stream creation request.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newJournalKinesisStreamDescription</a> smart
--   constructor.
data JournalKinesisStreamDescription
JournalKinesisStreamDescription' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe ErrorCause -> Maybe POSIX -> Text -> Text -> Text -> StreamStatus -> KinesisConfiguration -> Text -> JournalKinesisStreamDescription

-- | Create a value of <a>JournalKinesisStreamDescription</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationTime:JournalKinesisStreamDescription'</a>,
--   <a>journalKinesisStreamDescription_creationTime</a> - The date and
--   time, in epoch time format, when the QLDB journal stream was created.
--   (Epoch time format is the number of seconds elapsed since 12:00:00 AM
--   January 1, 1970 UTC.)
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:JournalKinesisStreamDescription'</a>,
--   <a>journalKinesisStreamDescription_arn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) of the QLDB journal stream.
--   
--   <a>$sel:inclusiveStartTime:JournalKinesisStreamDescription'</a>,
--   <a>journalKinesisStreamDescription_inclusiveStartTime</a> - The
--   inclusive start date and time from which to start streaming journal
--   data.
--   
--   <a>$sel:errorCause:JournalKinesisStreamDescription'</a>,
--   <a>journalKinesisStreamDescription_errorCause</a> - The error message
--   that describes the reason that a stream has a status of
--   <tt>IMPAIRED</tt> or <tt>FAILED</tt>. This is not applicable to
--   streams that have other status values.
--   
--   <a>$sel:exclusiveEndTime:JournalKinesisStreamDescription'</a>,
--   <a>journalKinesisStreamDescription_exclusiveEndTime</a> - The
--   exclusive date and time that specifies when the stream ends. If this
--   parameter is undefined, the stream runs indefinitely until you cancel
--   it.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ledgerName:JournalKinesisStreamDescription'</a>,
--   <a>journalKinesisStreamDescription_ledgerName</a> - The name of the
--   ledger.
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleArn:JournalKinesisStreamDescription'</a>,
--   <a>journalKinesisStreamDescription_roleArn</a> - The Amazon Resource
--   Name (ARN) of the IAM role that grants QLDB permissions for a journal
--   stream to write data records to a Kinesis Data Streams resource.
--   
--   <a>$sel:streamId:JournalKinesisStreamDescription'</a>,
--   <a>journalKinesisStreamDescription_streamId</a> - The UUID
--   (represented in Base62-encoded text) of the QLDB journal stream.
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:JournalKinesisStreamDescription'</a>,
--   <a>journalKinesisStreamDescription_status</a> - The current state of
--   the QLDB journal stream.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kinesisConfiguration:JournalKinesisStreamDescription'</a>,
--   <a>journalKinesisStreamDescription_kinesisConfiguration</a> - The
--   configuration settings of the Amazon Kinesis Data Streams destination
--   for a QLDB journal stream.
--   
--   <a>$sel:streamName:JournalKinesisStreamDescription'</a>,
--   <a>journalKinesisStreamDescription_streamName</a> - The user-defined
--   name of the QLDB journal stream.
newJournalKinesisStreamDescription :: Text -> Text -> Text -> StreamStatus -> KinesisConfiguration -> Text -> JournalKinesisStreamDescription

-- | Information about a journal export job, including the ledger name,
--   export ID, creation time, current status, and the parameters of the
--   original export creation request.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newJournalS3ExportDescription</a> smart constructor.
data JournalS3ExportDescription
