-- | Create a value of <a>JournalS3ExportDescription</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:ledgerName:JournalS3ExportDescription'</a>,
--   <a>journalS3ExportDescription_ledgerName</a> - The name of the ledger.
--   
--   <a>$sel:exportId:JournalS3ExportDescription'</a>,
--   <a>journalS3ExportDescription_exportId</a> - The UUID (represented in
--   Base62-encoded text) of the journal export job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:exportCreationTime:JournalS3ExportDescription'</a>,
--   <a>journalS3ExportDescription_exportCreationTime</a> - The date and
--   time, in epoch time format, when the export job was created. (Epoch
--   time format is the number of seconds elapsed since 12:00:00 AM January
--   1, 1970 UTC.)
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:JournalS3ExportDescription'</a>,
--   <a>journalS3ExportDescription_status</a> - The current state of the
--   journal export job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:inclusiveStartTime:JournalS3ExportDescription'</a>,
--   <a>journalS3ExportDescription_inclusiveStartTime</a> - The inclusive
--   start date and time for the range of journal contents that are
--   specified in the original export request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:exclusiveEndTime:JournalS3ExportDescription'</a>,
--   <a>journalS3ExportDescription_exclusiveEndTime</a> - The exclusive end
--   date and time for the range of journal contents that are specified in
--   the original export request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:s3ExportConfiguration:JournalS3ExportDescription'</a>,
--   <a>journalS3ExportDescription_s3ExportConfiguration</a> - Undocumented
--   member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleArn:JournalS3ExportDescription'</a>,
--   <a>journalS3ExportDescription_roleArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) of the IAM role that grants QLDB permissions for a journal
--   export job to do the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Write objects into your Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3)
--   bucket.</li>
--   <li>(Optional) Use your customer master key (CMK) in Key Management
--   Service (KMS) for server-side encryption of your exported data.</li>
--   </ul>
newJournalS3ExportDescription :: Text -> Text -> UTCTime -> ExportStatus -> UTCTime -> UTCTime -> S3ExportConfiguration -> Text -> JournalS3ExportDescription

-- | The configuration settings of the Amazon Kinesis Data Streams
--   destination for an Amazon QLDB journal stream.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newKinesisConfiguration</a> smart constructor.
data KinesisConfiguration
KinesisConfiguration' :: Maybe Bool -> Text -> KinesisConfiguration

-- | Create a value of <a>KinesisConfiguration</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:aggregationEnabled:KinesisConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>kinesisConfiguration_aggregationEnabled</a> - Enables QLDB to
--   publish multiple data records in a single Kinesis Data Streams record,
--   increasing the number of records sent per API call.
--   
--   <i>This option is enabled by default.</i> Record aggregation has
--   important implications for processing records and requires
--   de-aggregation in your stream consumer. To learn more, see <a>KPL Key
--   Concepts</a> and <a>Consumer De-aggregation</a> in the <i>Amazon
--   Kinesis Data Streams Developer Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:streamArn:KinesisConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>kinesisConfiguration_streamArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN)
--   of the Kinesis Data Streams resource.
newKinesisConfiguration :: Text -> KinesisConfiguration

-- | Information about the encryption of data at rest in an Amazon QLDB
--   ledger. This includes the current status, the key in Key Management
--   Service (KMS), and when the key became inaccessible (in the case of an
--   error).
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Encryption at rest</a> in the <i>Amazon
--   QLDB Developer Guide</i>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newLedgerEncryptionDescription</a> smart constructor.
data LedgerEncryptionDescription
LedgerEncryptionDescription' :: Maybe POSIX -> Text -> EncryptionStatus -> LedgerEncryptionDescription

-- | Create a value of <a>LedgerEncryptionDescription</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:inaccessibleKmsKeyDateTime:LedgerEncryptionDescription'</a>,
--   <a>ledgerEncryptionDescription_inaccessibleKmsKeyDateTime</a> - The
--   date and time, in epoch time format, when the KMS key first became
--   inaccessible, in the case of an error. (Epoch time format is the
--   number of seconds that have elapsed since 12:00:00 AM January 1, 1970
--   UTC.)
--   
--   This parameter is undefined if the KMS key is accessible.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kmsKeyArn:LedgerEncryptionDescription'</a>,
--   <a>ledgerEncryptionDescription_kmsKeyArn</a> - The Amazon Resource
--   Name (ARN) of the customer managed KMS key that the ledger uses for
--   encryption at rest. If this parameter is undefined, the ledger uses an
--   Amazon Web Services owned KMS key for encryption.
--   
--   <a>$sel:encryptionStatus:LedgerEncryptionDescription'</a>,
--   <a>ledgerEncryptionDescription_encryptionStatus</a> - The current
--   state of encryption at rest for the ledger. This can be one of the
--   following values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>ENABLED</tt>: Encryption is fully enabled using the specified
--   key.</li>
--   <li><tt>UPDATING</tt>: The ledger is actively processing the specified
--   key change.Key changes in QLDB are asynchronous. The ledger is fully
--   accessible without any performance impact while the key change is
--   being processed. The amount of time it takes to update a key varies
--   depending on the ledger size.</li>
--   <li><tt>KMS_KEY_INACCESSIBLE</tt>: The specified customer managed KMS
--   key is not accessible, and the ledger is impaired. Either the key was
--   disabled or deleted, or the grants on the key were revoked. When a
--   ledger is impaired, it is not accessible and does not accept any read
--   or write requests.An impaired ledger automatically returns to an
--   active state after you restore the grants on the key, or re-enable the
--   key that was disabled. However, deleting a customer managed KMS key is
--   irreversible. After a key is deleted, you can no longer access the
--   ledgers that are protected with that key, and the data becomes
--   unrecoverable permanently.</li>
--   </ul>
newLedgerEncryptionDescription :: Text -> EncryptionStatus -> LedgerEncryptionDescription

-- | Information about a ledger, including its name, state, and when it was
--   created.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newLedgerSummary</a> smart constructor.
data LedgerSummary
LedgerSummary' :: Maybe LedgerState -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> LedgerSummary

-- | Create a value of <a>LedgerSummary</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:state:LedgerSummary'</a>, <a>ledgerSummary_state</a> - The
--   current status of the ledger.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:LedgerSummary'</a>, <a>ledgerSummary_name</a> - The name
--   of the ledger.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationDateTime:LedgerSummary'</a>,
--   <a>ledgerSummary_creationDateTime</a> - The date and time, in epoch
--   time format, when the ledger was created. (Epoch time format is the
--   number of seconds elapsed since 12:00:00 AM January 1, 1970 UTC.)
newLedgerSummary :: LedgerSummary

-- | The encryption settings that are used by a journal export job to write
--   data in an Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) bucket.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newS3EncryptionConfiguration</a> smart constructor.
data S3EncryptionConfiguration
S3EncryptionConfiguration' :: Maybe Text -> S3ObjectEncryptionType -> S3EncryptionConfiguration

-- | Create a value of <a>S3EncryptionConfiguration</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:kmsKeyArn:S3EncryptionConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>s3EncryptionConfiguration_kmsKeyArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) of a symmetric customer master key (CMK) in Key Management
--   Service (KMS). Amazon S3 does not support asymmetric CMKs.
--   
--   You must provide a <tt>KmsKeyArn</tt> if you specify <tt>SSE_KMS</tt>
--   as the <tt>ObjectEncryptionType</tt>.
--   
--   <tt>KmsKeyArn</tt> is not required if you specify <tt>SSE_S3</tt> as
--   the <tt>ObjectEncryptionType</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:objectEncryptionType:S3EncryptionConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>s3EncryptionConfiguration_objectEncryptionType</a> - The Amazon S3
--   object encryption type.
--   
--   To learn more about server-side encryption options in Amazon S3, see
--   <a>Protecting Data Using Server-Side Encryption</a> in the <i>Amazon
--   S3 Developer Guide</i>.
newS3EncryptionConfiguration :: S3ObjectEncryptionType -> S3EncryptionConfiguration

-- | The Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) bucket location in which
--   a journal export job writes the journal contents.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newS3ExportConfiguration</a> smart constructor.
data S3ExportConfiguration
S3ExportConfiguration' :: Text -> Text -> S3EncryptionConfiguration -> S3ExportConfiguration

-- | Create a value of <a>S3ExportConfiguration</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:bucket:S3ExportConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>s3ExportConfiguration_bucket</a> - The Amazon S3 bucket name in
--   which a journal export job writes the journal contents.
--   
--   The bucket name must comply with the Amazon S3 bucket naming
--   conventions. For more information, see <a>Bucket Restrictions and
--   Limitations</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 Developer Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:prefix:S3ExportConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>s3ExportConfiguration_prefix</a> - The prefix for the Amazon S3
--   bucket in which a journal export job writes the journal contents.
--   
--   The prefix must comply with Amazon S3 key naming rules and
--   restrictions. For more information, see <a>Object Key and Metadata</a>
--   in the <i>Amazon S3 Developer Guide</i>.
--   
--   The following are examples of valid <tt>Prefix</tt> values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>JournalExports-ForMyLedger/Testing/</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>JournalExports</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>My:Tests/</pre></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:encryptionConfiguration:S3ExportConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>s3ExportConfiguration_encryptionConfiguration</a> - The encryption
--   settings that are used by a journal export job to write data in an
--   Amazon S3 bucket.
newS3ExportConfiguration :: Text -> Text -> S3EncryptionConfiguration -> S3ExportConfiguration

-- | A structure that can contain a value in multiple encoding formats.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newValueHolder</a> smart constructor.
data ValueHolder
ValueHolder' :: Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> ValueHolder

-- | Create a value of <a>ValueHolder</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:ionText:ValueHolder'</a>, <a>valueHolder_ionText</a> - An
--   Amazon Ion plaintext value contained in a <tt>ValueHolder</tt>
--   structure.
newValueHolder :: ValueHolder
